title: Tutorials/Playing with a controller
summary:
Here is a quick tutorial on how to use a controller (PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, etc.) as input while playing the Java Edition of Minecraft.
The Java Edition of Minecraft does not natively support controllers, but here there will be described easy workarounds that allows you to use a controller for playing Minecraft: Java Edition.
In order to play Minecraft Java with a controller, you need an app that can run in the background and transmit the controller’s input to the game, and you need to configure it so that the controls are transmitted correctly.

summary: Flat survival beyond mere subsistence is particularly challenging in Bedrock Edition because there are no structures and no materials to start with except for unlimited dirt three layers deep with bedrock underneath. title: Tutorials/Getting to the worldborder
summary: Getting to the world border is a daunting task. In vanilla Minecraft, the world border is situated 30,000,000 blocks from the world spawn point in each direction. There are numerous methods to help the player get there, for example, using the Nether to divide the distance needed to be covered by 8.

title: Family
summary: A family is a unique technical label for Bedrock Edition, which specifies the family to which an mob or an entity belongs. The family of entity is defined in the entity components' minecraft:type_family. Families are used in commands such as target selector and create Add-on.

title: Translucency
summary: Translucency is a concept very closely related to transparency. Blocks, items, entities and other game elements said to be translucent allow for vision to pass through them partially, but not fully.

title: Tutorials/Village survival
summary: Village survival is a survival gameplay of surviving in the village. In the village, you can trade with villagers to get food, tools, and so on. This tutorial will teach you how to do that.

title: Tutorials/End of light mob farms
summary: The end of light mob farm involves 2 key components - update suppressors and light suppressors using an update suppressor to prevent the portals from updating when the side obsidian blocks are removed. This creates a sliced portal in which mobs can spawn where the light level is 0. The light suppressors allow the light levels of the portal blocks to be 0, meaning that mobs can spawn directly into the portals and get transported into a drop chute.

title: Tutorials/Update suppression
summary: Update suppression is the practice of forcing the game to skip block updates.

title: Launcher 2.2.1032x/Development versions
summary:
This is a list of Launcher 2.2.1032x development versions.


== 2.2.9699 ==
2.2.9716 (Windows), 2.2.9699 (Windows, via the Microsoft Store/Xbox app), 2.2.9709 (macOS), or 2.2.9700 (Linux), was an update to the launcher released on February 1, 2022.


=== Changes ===
Updated Preview images on the Bedrock tab to more beautiful and less blurry versions.


=== Fixes ===
Fixed several crashes and under-the-hood user issues.
Fixed loading problem that sometimes occurred during a game installation.
MCL-17395 - The EN_US strings, "Credits and Third party licenses" and "Third party licenses", are both missing a hyphen between the words "Third" and "party".
MCL-20855 - Using Tab key in Game Output will select two invisible "buttons".


== 2.2.1027x ==
2.2.10271 (Windows), 2.2.10272 (Windows, via the Microsoft Store/Xbox app), 2.2.10274 (macOS), or 2.2.10273 (Linux), was an update to the launcher released on February 7, 2022.


=== Changes ===
Fixed some links from the Launcher which were pointing to the wrong places.
Updated textures of the ore icons in Installation screen.


=== Fixes ===
Fixed some user launch issues, crashes, and other critical bugs.
MCL-13519 - Launcher fails to launch game and then incorrectly claims that the game is already running.
MCL-17983 - Outdated ore textures in installation icon dropdown.
MCL-21061 - Instead of using saved password users now have to enter two passwords.


== Notes and references ==

TNT is an explosive block in Minecraft. 
It can be used by using a flint and steel or a fire charge on it. A flint and steel loses durability when used to light TNT.

title: Tutorials/Tracking
summary:
(This tutorial refers to the skill of hunting down other players in Multiplayer Minecraft. To learn how to navigate in Minecraft, see Tutorials/Navigation.)
Tracking is a crucial skill in Minecraft. It is extremely helpful when attempting to get rid of other people that might be a threat to someone on a server. There are many methods of tracking in MInecraft. One common method is to use a map to locate other players, then go to them and hunt them down. In gamemodes such as Minecraft Manhunt, the hunter is given a compass to use to follow to track down the closest speedrunner.  Another very sneaky way is to find someone who is shifting underground without a map is to utilize the list of Minecraft players and their faces.

title: Tutorials/Conquering a mountain
summary:
Mountains are a type of terrain that appear in many different designs, but are typically described as very tall. They can be part of the badlands, possess a barren surface made of stone, or have snowy slopes. Conquering a mountain can be quite a challenge, especially for unprepared players, due to the several dangers, including deep patches of powder snow, the ramming goats, and of course, its steep and towering heights. However, not all mountains are generated equally as it can sometimes just be a big meadow hill or a short mountain peak, so it's best to find one with very tall terrain and a "peak" biome. 
There are many reasons for conquering a mountain. Perhaps you want to harvest its massive reserves of snow (Snowy slopes, jagged and frozen peaks only), stone, calcite (Stony peaks only), spruce wood (Groves only), iron, coal, or even emerald ore or build something cool on top, or try to find a deep dark underground for an ancient city, or maybe you simply want to do it for the fun or challenge.

summary: Ancient cities are among the most dangerous and challenging structures to explore in the game. It is mostly dark throughout, and while the cities do not have any normal hostile mobs in them, they are home to wardens, which can easily slaughter players, even in full netherite armor.

summary: 1.18 Release Candidate 1 (known as 1.18-rc1 in the launcher) is the first release candidate for Java Edition 1.18, released on November 25, 2021, which increases the size limit for server resource packs and fixes a bug related to a memory leak.

title: Jungle Bush
summary: A jungle bush is one of the rarest plants in the game, they generate in jungles and cannot be grown by jungle saplings.

title: Bedrock Developer Beta
summary: The Bedrock Developer Beta is a beta version of Bedrock Edition accessible only by developers and marketplace content creators. There hasn't been much documentation of the version.

title: Art style
summary:
These are art styles used in the Minecraft franchise:

Mini art, a chibi-like art style stylizing characters with small bodies and large heads
Pixel art, the pixelated art style used in mob votes
Plastic art, an art style with simple colors and a plastic look
Programmer art, the look of Minecraft before the Texture Update
Sketches, the look of pencil and paper used in concept art and the Mobestiary

The Minecraft Antiquated Robot Inadequate Loves Lying Audaciously, also known as MARILLA or M.A.R.I.L.L.A, is a character in the official Minecraft YouTube channel voiced by Marilla Wex.
She hosted the series Ten Things You Probably Didn't Know About Minecraft and then co-hosted The Secrets of Minecraft with Narrator from How We Make Minecraft.

title: Mo

title: Tutorials/Fern farming
summary: Fern farming is a process of farming ferns by applying bone meal to existing ferns and mining the increased layer with shears.

title: Rudi
summary: Rudi is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and is part of Team Tundra with Sacha.

title: Tutorials/Wandering trader farming
summary: Wandering trader farming is the process of farming wandering traders for their trades, and/or disposing them and their llamas to get leads and leather. It's a farm to build to glitchlessly renewably farm items like sand, red sand and small dripleaf. However, in a normal minecraft world, all those things are easy to get, so it isn't the most practical farm.  Additionally, it will require several emeralds, so you might need to have a villager trading hall or raid farm. This farm is generally only useful for single biomes or other types of survival challenges, where some resources are limited (for example a ice only world where you can't get red sand).

title: Tutorials/Cat gift farming
summary: Cat gift farming is a process of using a tamed cat to give you items in the morning if it sleeps on or is near enough to a bed which the player is sleeping in to skip the night. It allows you to renewably farm rabbit's feet, rabbit hide, string, rotten flesh, feathers, raw chicken and phantom membranes without much effort, and is another option of obtaining phantom membranes if killing phantoms is not a viable option (e.g. a server with One Person Sleeps mod, or a half hearted hardcore world).

title: Java Edition 1.18 Pre-release 2
summary: 1.18 Pre-release 2 (known as 1.18-pre2 in the launcher) is the second pre-release for Java Edition 1.18, released on November 16, 2021, which increased the required minimum Java version from 16 to 17, and fixed bugs.

title: Quinn
summary: Quinn is a female character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Stone Beach with Toby. She helps everyone to try and escape CommuniKate's game show, winning a few minigames, and ultimately winning Season 1. She then teamed up with Durango, CommuniKate, and Zed in Season 2, The Greek Isles after Poseidon takes over.

title: River (Character)
summary: River is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Mesa with Durango.

summary: Durango is a character in the Minecraft Mini-Series and part of Team Mesa with River (Character).

title: Tutorials/Nether growth farming
summary: Nether growth farming is the process of farming warped and crimson fungi and roots.

title: Tutorials/Wolf and fox farming
summary: Wolf and fox farming is a process of farming animals like wolves and foxes using natural generation mechanics in taigas.

title: Tutorials/Weeping and twisting vine farming
summary: Nether vine farming is the process of farming weeping and twisting vines, using bonemeal or growth mechanics, and with a system to harvest the grown vines and collect the drops.

title: Java Edition distance effects/Historical effects
summary: This page is a near-comprehensive list of all known distance effects throughout the game's history. A page that only accounts for those which affect the latest versions of the game can be found at Java Edition distance effects.

title: Tutorials/How to get rid of a rogue wither
summary: If you spawned a wither, got killed, and now it's going berserk in a random place, and effectively you cannot enter the area without a major risk to your life? Need to get rid of it? Then here it is, this guide will help you get rid of the wither!

summary: Beta 1.18.0.27 is the seventh and final beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.18.0, released on November 11, 2021, which fixes bugs.

title: Java Edition 1.18 Pre-release 1
summary: 1.18 Pre-release 1 (known as 1.18-pre1 in the launcher) is the first pre-release for Java Edition 1.18, released on November 11, 2021, which readded Amplified and Large Biomes, made some tweaks, and fixed bugs.

title: Monolith
summary: Monoliths were glitched areas of terrain that happened in the later versions of Infdev and early Alpha eras of the game. These monoliths would cause the terrain to abruptly generate up to the height limit, with natural grass block and ore generation.

title: Tutorials/Wither rose farming
summary: Wither rose farming is the process of trapping withers and using them to kill mobs and make them drop wither roses.

title: Tutorials/Wither choker
summary: A wither choker is a machine that is designed to kill withers by suffocating them in a bedrock trap mainly using the bedrock fountain in the End or the Nether roof in the Nether.

title: Tutorials/Ender dragon farming
summary: Ender dragon farming is the process of farming Minecraft's final boss by respawning it using end crystals and killing it with a farm mechanism, ideally with TNT, withers or a player. It does not yield any drops on its own but is one of the most powerful XP farms in the game. You can also farm end stone with this because end stone generates under the bedrock portal frame every time the dragon respawns, and torches with a system that will break them and collect them. You can even farm obsidian with this method using trapped withers in the right places, since the obsidian that makes up the end spikes/towers regenerate when the dragon is resurrected.

title: Tutorials/Root farming
summary: Root farming is the process of farming rooted dirt and hanging roots.

title: Tutorials/Chunk ban
summary: Chunk banning is making a chunk or area have too much data for servers to send to the client, so it is forced to kick you off the server if you are near enough to the chunk ban.

title: Bedrock Edition beta 1.18.0.25
summary:
Beta 1.18.0.25 is the sixth beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.18.0, released on November 4, 2021, which fixes bugs.
This version was reuploaded around a few hours later on Windows to fix the version having no RenderDragon rendering engine.

title: Tutorials/Adding profiles to the new launcher
summary: As Mojang Studios has now added both Java Edition and Bedrock Edition versions of Minecraft to Xbox Game Pass for PC with the 2.2.720x update to the launcher, it has caused a few bugs. This tutorial will show you how to download Java Edition profiles (Mod loaders, OptiFine, etc.) to the new launcher.

title: Java Edition 21w44a
summary: 21w44a is the eighth and final snapshot for Java Edition 1.18, released on November 3, 2021, which improved the upgrading of old worlds, introduced new options, made some tweaks, and fixed bugs. It is also the final snapshot of 2021.

title: Launcher 2.2.726x
summary:
2.2.7265 (Windows), 2.2.7264 (Windows, via the Microsoft Store/Xbox app), 2.2.7268 (macOS), or 2.2.7266 (Linux), was an update to the launcher released on November 2, 2021.
This version was the first released to the Windows Store and merged the three PC entries of the Minecraft franchise: Java and Bedrock editions and Minecraft Dungeons.

title: Launcher 2.2.720x
summary: 2.2.7206 (Windows), 2.2.7207 (Windows, via the Microsoft Store/Xbox app), 2.2.7205 (macOS), or 2.2.7204 (Linux), was an update to the launcher released on November 1, 2021, this is the first version of the launcher distributed to the Microsoft Store/Xbox app.

title: Tutorials/Glow berry farming
summary: Glow berry farming is the process of producing more glow berries by applying bone meal to an existing one, or by leaving it and harvesting it when it increases in height. It allows you to obtain more glow berries without having to find them. Naturally-generated glow berries are extremely rare, with the only other way having to find them in mineshaft chests, so having a way to farm them is handy, however the primary use of glow berries is for decoration (they make a good aesthetic light for most builds, especially rustic style) since it can only be used elsewhere to breed foxes and a very low saturation food, so consider that before deciding to produce more of them.

title: Green Shrub
summary: Green shrubs were variants of the grass block ID with block metadata with a value from 3 to 15 inclusive in Java Edition. Unlike the intentionally-implemented shrub, their color changed depending on the biome.

title: Mobs of Minecraft
summary: Mobs of Minecraft is a series of children's books written by Christy Webster and illustrated by Alan Batson. Each book includes a press-out foldable figure of the mob featured.

title: Water lake
summary: A water lake was a small body of water source blocks in the Overworld. It could generate both on the surface and underground, in the latter case an air pocket would generate above it.

title: Tutorials/Bedrock farming
summary: Bedrock farming is a method of using glitches, mainly with an end gateway portal or the bedrock portal frame in the End, to obtain bedrock blocks in Survival mode without commands or cheating.

title: Tutorials/Phantom farming
summary: Phantom farming is a method of farming phantoms by not sleeping for a while, then afking in a phantom trap which is designed to kill the phantoms but allow you to obtain phantom membranes.

title: Minecraft: Castle Redstone
summary: Minecraft: Castle Redstone is the fourteenth Minecraft novel. It is authored by Sarwat Chadda and was published by Del Rey Books on November 29, 2022. An audiobook was released the same day, with narration provided by Shawn Jain.

title: Tutorials/Dirt farming
summary: Dirt farming is the ability to renewably farm dirt without having to mine it from surrounding environments.

title: Tutorials/Sculk farming
summary: Sculk farming is a method of farming XP and/or sculk growth blocks for decoration by using the sculk catalyst block. Since mobs normally only drop XP when killed by a player, and sculk blocks drop XP when mined, this can also be used for bulk XP storage.

title: Bedrock Edition 1.17.41
summary: 1.17.41 is a minor update to Bedrock Edition released for most platforms on October 27, 2021, and released for Fire tablets on October 29, 2021, which fixes bugs. This version is still compatible with all Bedrock platforms running on 1.17.40.

title: Ice Patch
summary: Ice patches are blobs of packed ice that generate exclusively in the ice spikes biome.

title: Weird Piston
summary: Weird pistons were extreme metadata variants of pistons which could be used as update suppression agents.

title: Java Edition missing texture and model uses/Invalid data value blocks
Content inaccessible in Survival
summary: There are many elements in Minecraft that are completely inaccessible to the player in Survival mode.

title: Tadpole
summary: A tadpole is the larval form of the frog. They mature into one of the three frog variants, depending on the biome in which they mature.

title: Bedrock Edition 1.19.0
summary: 1.19.0 (Android, iOS, iPadOS, Fire, Windows, Xbox, PlayStation) or 1.19.1 (Nintendo Switch), the first release of The Wild Update, is a major update to Bedrock Edition released on June 7, 2022. The update was first announced on October 16, 2021 during Minecraft Live 2021.  It introduces the deep dark biome, the mangrove swamp biome, mobs like the allay, the frog, the tadpole, the warden, and some new items included like sculk blocks and other items that are useful and for decorations.

title: Mangrove
summary: Mangrove trees are found in mangrove swamps, in which they can grow on water or land. They have large canopies and aerial root systems. Their wood color is vermillion. They can be planted in the air, but their roots always touch the ground.

title: Boat with Chest
summary: A boat with chest is a single chest occupying the passenger seat of a boat, and functions as such. As it can still be driven it can be used to transport items over bodies of water.

title: Java Edition 1.19
summary: 1.19, the first release of The Wild Update, is a major update to Java Edition, released on June 7, 2022. The update was first announced on October 16, 2021, during Minecraft Live 2021. It introduces brand-new materials, blocks, and locations, such as the Deep Dark and mangrove swamp biomes; ancient cities; mobs like the warden, the frog, the tadpole, and the allay, as well as new items obtainable only in these new biomes.

title: Tutorials/Clay farming
summary: Clay farming is a 1.19 feature that makes clay much simpler to farm, as well as blocks like mud. It requires you to soak a dirt block with a water bottle to turn it into mud, and then place it over a dripstone block which has a dripstone below it, which will "dry out" the mud block and turn it into clay.

title: Taxicab distance
summary: Taxicab distance, also known as rectilinear distance, city block distance, Manhattan distance, and other names, is a metric in taxicab geometry for measuring distance, as an alternative to Euclidean distance (straight-line, or "as the crow flies"). Minecraft uses taxicab distance as an efficient range measurement in several elements of the game.

title: Java Edition Classic 0.24 Resource Test
summary: 0.24 Resource Test is a version of Minecraft Classic released in 2009. It was released to test resource gathering.

title: Bedrock Edition placeholder texture uses
summary:
This page documents all known cases where placeholder textures are or were used in vanilla Bedrock Edition.
For this page, due to the nature and intended use of placeholder textures, "vanilla" is defined in a much more strict sense than normal: alongside having no mods installed, use of non-default texture packs is also forbidden, as these can allow for arbitrary blocks, items and so on to point to copies of the placeholder texture.

title: Legacy Console Edition default texture uses
summary: This page documents all known cases where the texture at (0,0) on the texture atlas was used unintentionally in vanilla Legacy Console Edition.

title: Bedrock Edition default texture uses
summary: This page documents all known cases where the texture at (0,0) on the texture atlas was used unintentionally in vanilla Bedrock Edition.

title: Java Edition default texture uses
summary: This page documents all known cases where the texture at (0,0) on the texture atlas was used unintentionally in vanilla Java Edition.

title: Legacy Console Edition placeholder texture uses
summary:
This page documents all known cases where placeholder textures are or were used in vanilla Legacy Console Edition.
For this page, due to the nature and intended use of placeholder textures, "vanilla" is defined in a much more strict sense than normal: alongside having no mods installed, use of non-default texture packs is also forbidden, as these can allow for arbitrary blocks, items and so on to point to copies of the placeholder texture.

title: Java Edition placeholder texture uses
summary:
This page documents all known cases where placeholder textures are or were used in vanilla Java Edition.
For this page, due to the nature and intended use of placeholder textures, "vanilla" is defined in a much more strict sense than normal: alongside having no mods installed, use of non-default texture packs is also forbidden, as these can allow for arbitrary blocks, items and so on to point to copies of the placeholder texture.

title: Bedrock Edition missing texture and model uses
summary:
This page documents all known cases where missing textures and models are or were used in vanilla Bedrock Edition.
For this page, due to the nature and intended use of missing textures and missing models, "vanilla" is defined in a much more strict sense than normal: alongside having no mods installed, use of non-default texture packs or resource packs, as well as non-default behavior packs, are also forbidden, as these can allow for the arbitrary occurrence of error handling assets.

title: Java Edition missing texture and model uses
summary:
This page documents all known cases where missing textures and models are or were used in vanilla Java Edition.
For this page, due to the nature and intended use of missing textures and missing models, "vanilla" is defined in a much more strict sense than normal: alongside having no mods installed, use of non-default texture packs or resource packs, as well as non-default data packs, are also forbidden, as these can allow for the arbitrary occurrence of error handling assets.

title: Tutorials/Moss farming
summary: Moss farming is using the feature of applying bone meal to a moss block and getting more moss blocks, as well as azalea and flowering azalea (which is a more efficient way to farm oak wood), moss carpet, seeds and grass.

title: Tutorials/Basalt farming
summary: Basalt farming is the technique of using a basalt generator to produce basalt without needing to mine for it from basalt deltas or from basalt pillars. Basalt generators work on the principle that when a lava stream encounters both blue ice and soul soil, it will produce the block, which can be mined with a pickaxe and used for decoration. Please note that soul sand will not work when making a basalt farm.

title: Tutorials/Lava farming
summary: Lava farming is the technique of using a pointed dripstone with a lava source above it and a cauldron beneath to obtain an infinite lava generator.

title: Tutorials/Potion farming
summary:
MAJOR DISCLAIMER:
Potion farming was patched in the 1.17.30 update as a result of being too overpowered.

title: Tutorials/Dripstone farming
summary: Dripstone farming is the renewable way to farm pointed dripstone and dripstone blocks. Dripstone is used to farm lava, and can also be used as fall damage traps for mob farms or for pranking, as it quadruples the amount of fall damage you take.

title: Tutorials/Amethyst farming
summary: Amethyst farming is the renewable way of obtaining amethyst shards, as well as small, medium, large amethyst buds and amethyst clusters. Amethyst shards are used to craft amethyst blocks for decoration and also is the only way to craft the Spyglass.

title: Tutorials/Flying machine uses
summary: A flying machine can be used for things other than flying.

title: Tutorials/Water-powered boat transportation
summary: Water-powered boat transportation is a flexible and reasonably easy way to transport mobs and villagers along arbitrary paths (even uphill‌) using only the power of flowing water, without the need for any tools more exotic than a bucket and pickaxe, and needing only three common materials (water, buttons‌ or signs, and common building blocks). No rowing, rails, minecarts, redstone gadgets, or bubble columns are needed, just a boat and water. With proper water management, one can construct flowing moats around arbitrary areas in which a boat can circle endlessly. The boat can even change elevation up or down using only the power of water flow.

== 2.2.27xx ==
2.2.2725 (Windows), 2.2.2724 (macOS), or 2.2.2730 (Linux), was an update to the launcher released on May 5, 2021.


=== Changes ===
Fixed build breaks on Unix-like systems
Fixed an issues with Windows not logging 'proper looking' paths in logs.
Various fixes on MacOS builds to improve reliability
Updated bootstrapper to remove dependency on vcruntime140.dll.
Added additional logging to catch CDN problems.


=== Fixes ===
MCL-17433 - First three columns of launcher log are displayed darker than they were previously.
MCL-17472 - Several search fields in the launcher are not selected when clicking on the search icon.


== 2.2.280x ==
2.2.2806 (Windows), 2.2.2804 (macOS), or 2.2.2803 (Linux), was an update to the launcher released on May 25, 2021.


=== Changes ===
Fixed build breaks on Unix-like systems.
Fixed an issues with Windows not logging 'proper looking' paths in logs.
Various fixes on MacOS builds to improve reliability.
Updated bootstrapper to remove dependency on vcruntime140.dll.
Added additional logging to catch CDN problems.


=== Fixes ===
MCL-17433 - First three columns of launcher log are displayed darker than they were previously.
MCL-17472 - Several search fields in the launcher are not selected when clicking on the search icon.
MCL-17281 - Launcher won't load.

title: Tutorials/See Minecraft's code
summary: Since snapshot 19w36a, Mojang releases obfuscation maps for every version available in the launcher. Those maps can be used to deobfuscate a version's JAR file, that is to say, replace obfuscated class names and class member names with their original (deobfuscated) names. Using a decompiler, it is possible to reconstruct human-readable Java code.

Its first release coincided with the announcement that Caves & Cliffs would be split into two major updates. The data pack was eventually superseded by experimental snapshots as changes that are too large for a data pack were introduced.

title: Procedural animated texture generation/Nether portals
summary:
Due to the large number of Atan2 and Sine operations, all frames of animation (a total of 32, at a resolution of 16×16) for the portal block are generated once at-startup and stored into an internal animation strip; The random shimmer is the same every time, as the game always uses a random number generator with a seed of 100L.
To generate one frame of the nether portal animation:

The portal block is the only one of the procedural textures that is ported 1:1 in the 1.5 resource pack changes; Unlike the water animations, the alpha channel was not made uniform in the 1.15 texture update.

== 1.17.1 Pre-release 1 ==
1.17.1 Pre-release 1 (known as 1.17.1-pre1 in the launcher) is the first pre-release for Java Edition 1.17.1, released on June 18, 2021, which tweaks some game mechanics and fixes bugs.


=== Changes ===


==== Blocks ====
Cauldrons
Powder snow now fills cauldrons 2 times as fast as before.


==== Items ====
Spyglass
Tweaked held model texture to include glass on the backside.


==== Mobs ====
Axolotl
Blue axolotls now only spawn through breeding.
Drowned
Increased the drop probability of copper ingot from 5% to 11%, and increased the drop rate boost with each level of the Looting enchantment from 1% to 2%.
This change is to match Bedrock Edition's drop rates.
Goats
Breeding common goats now has a chance to produce screaming goats.
Status effects applied to goats now also apply when the goat is jumping or ramming.
Zombies, Zombie Villagers, Husks and Drowned
No longer pick up glow ink sacs.
This prevents zombies from persisting after picking up the loot of a dead glow squid.


==== General ====
Protocol
Handshake packet padding method for "hostname" and "port" field has reverted to pre-1.17 when the server address which used is a SRV record.
Now, data padded in these field will use the address and port which SRV record pointed at, instead of using "server address" as "hostname" and 25565 as "port".
Fonts
Some new characters have been added.
Includes several currency symbols and some new emoji.
The new characters are: ✂🍖🪣🔔⏳⚑₠₡₢₣₤₥₦₩₫₭₮₰₱₲₳₵₶₷₸₹₺₻₼₿


=== Fixes ===
29 issues fixed
From released versions before 1.17
MC-123654 – Sun, moon, and/or clouds are not showing if render distance is below 4.
MC-131290 – Enchantments are saved as shorts, but are loaded as and function with integer values.
MC-156155 – Turkish lira sign (₺) appears as □ in the game.
MC-194736 – Duplicate text mapping for U+00B7.
MC-196999 – U+1FEC is wrong in Minecraft's font.
MC-223350 – Loaded chunks sometimes don't render until the player moves their head slightly.
From 1.17
MC-213986 – Pistons and dispensers can be used to create ghost blocks using powder snow.
MC-219018 – Ghost items can be created using /item (server doesn't update client inventory correctly).
MC-223368 – Strength and weakness potions / custom attack damage attributes does not change damage from goats.
MC-225816 – Hanging roots appear large when an item entity.
MC-226461 – Logs can be replaced with stone near lava pools.
MC-226505 – Goat's long jump is not affected by the jump boost effect.
MC-226512 – Goats do not use the damage of held items when ramming entities.
MC-226948 – Withers are now affected by potion effects.
MC-227387 – World gen datapacks will likely crash or softlock the game.
MC-227435 – Lag when placing heads of non-existent players when on servers.
MC-227483 – root_system feature config's codec uses a wrong field.
MC-227520 – Overworld Fossils always generate at bedrock level.
MC-227557 – End portal texture appears stretched after world conversion.
MC-227618 – Small dripleaf is consumed without being placed when used on tall seagrass.
MC-227651 – Group for lapis lazuli ore smelting and blasting recipes is misspelled.
MC-227821 – Client crash when trying to create/edit realm immediately after deleting previous one.
MC-227891 – Ender pearls despawn when a player logs out of a server.
MC-228219 – Thrown ender pearls disappear upon entering the exit end portal.
MC-228343 – java.lang.NullPointerException when random_selector default feature isn't found.
MC-228430 – Very long loading pause while booting the game ("Failed to add PDH Counter", caused by oshi).
MC-228828 – Specifying the --server parameter when starting the game, causes the game to crash.
MC-229299 – Blue axolotls can spawn naturally.
Other
Duplication exploit with anvils.


== 1.17.1 Pre-release 2 ==
1.17.1 Pre-release 2 (known as 1.17.1-pre2 in the launcher) is the second pre-release for Java Edition 1.17.1, released on June 29, 2021, which adds the feature for the logging of named mobs' deaths and fixes bugs.


=== Additions ===


==== General ====
Languages
Added Classical Chinese.


=== Changes ===


==== General ====
Languages
Removed the following languages due to incomplete translations:
East Allgovian German
Manx
Sicilian
Logging
Deaths of named mobs are now logged.


=== Fixes ===
8 issues fixed
From 1.17
MC-219290 – Calcite is too quiet compared to other blocks.
MC-221656 – Creative mode obtained bucket of axolotl/tropical fish only spawns one kind axolotl/tropical fish.
MC-226926 – Emerald ore generates too often.
MC-228599 – Attempting to walk through flowing water constantly switches the player from swimming into normal mode.
MC-229191 – Diamond ore distribution changed between 1.16.5 and 1.17.
MC-229441 – You can steal the item a villager is holding for trade by killing it.
MC-229614 – Wandering Trader obtained tropical fish are only white kob.
From the previous development version
MC-229983 – /clear command doesn't clear certain stacks after dropping items from them.


== 1.17.1 Pre-release 3 ==
1.17.1 Pre-release 3 (known as 1.17.1-pre3 in the launcher) is the third and final pre-release for Java Edition 1.17.1, released on June 30, 2021, which fixes bugs.


=== Fixes ===
8 issues fixed
From released versions before 1.17
MC-224894 – Light tickets are released too early.
From 1.17
MC-222731 – Captured axolotl constantly tries to leave water.
MC-228802 – Chunks not loading on a server / Cannot invoke cmq.a(int, int, int) because ☃ is null.
MC-228858 – Axolotls despawning though named and on leashes.
MC-229169 – Piglins can no longer hear players breaking protected blocks through walls.
MC-229246 – Piglins and piglin brutes no longer call other piglins after attacking one of them behind walls.
From the Java Edition 1.17.1 development versions
MC-229475 – Placing a small dripleaf results in the top half of water getting deleted.
MC-229887 – "Unable to create a jar-filesystem" warning logged upon starting the game.


== 1.17.1 Release Candidate 1 ==
1.17.1 Release Candidate 1 (known as 1.17.1-rc1 in the launcher) is the first release candidate for Java Edition 1.17.1, released on July 1, 2021, which fixes bugs and crashes.


=== Additions ===


==== General ====
Death messages
Two previously untranslated death messages for some underwater mobs have been given messages:
<Name> died from dehydration;
<Name> died from dehydration whilst trying to escape <Name>.


=== Fixes ===
2 issues fixed
From 1.17
MC-230716 – death.attack.dryout and death.attack.dryout.player display raw translation strings (are untranslated).
Other
Fixed crashes.


== 1.17.1 Release Candidate 2 ==
1.17.1 Release Candidate 2 (known as 1.17.1-rc2 in the launcher) is the second and final release candidate for Java Edition 1.17.1, released on July 5, 2021, which fixes some critical issues.


=== Fixes ===
2 issues fixed
Private issues
A private issue was fixed.
Other
Fixed some critical issues.

== 1.14.40 ==
1.14.40 is a beta for Education Edition 1.14.50, released on October 14, 2020, which added new Learn to Code features.


=== Additions ===


==== General ====
Coding interface
New coding interface (IDE) uses python in a notebook-style interface which alternates between instructions and opportunities to write code.


=== Changes ===


==== General ====
Code Builder
Relocated menus to provide more space for coding and the menu options to be more understandable.
Home and Reset Editor buttons have been added to the Code Builder menu.
Library Updates
Mac and iPad users can now share or assign Library lessons via Google Classroom or email.
URL Allow List
All authentication is now done using *.minecrafteduservices.com.


=== Fixes ===
Various fixes to address known issues.

title: Bedrock Edition 1.18.0
summary: 1.18.0, the first release of Caves & Cliffs: Part II, is a major update to Bedrock Edition released on November 30, 2021. It was first announced alongside the release of the Java Edition 1.17 snapshot 21w15a when Mojang Studios stated the Caves & Cliffs update would be split in two. Features from 1.18.0 were being developed alongside 1.17.0 through Experimental Gameplay. This is the third major update for Bedrock Edition that is split into several updates since Village & Pillage in 2019.

title: Marker
summary: Markers are entities intended for use in data packs and map-making. They can only be created with the /summon command.

title: Block of Raw Iron
summary: A block of raw iron is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw iron.

title: Block of Raw Copper
summary: A block of raw copper is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw copper.

title: Java Edition 1.18
summary: 1.18, the first release of Caves & Cliffs: Part II, is a major update to Java Edition released on November 30, 2021. It completely overhauls the Overworld generation, with larger caves, taller mountains, new mountain biomes, new cave biomes, and flooded caves. It was first announced alongside the release of 1.17 snapshot 21w15a when Mojang Studios stated that the Caves & Cliffs update would be split in two. Some features for 1.18 were initially implemented during 1.17's development cycle, before getting postponed and relegated to official data packs used with a corresponding 1.17 snapshot.

title: Block of Raw Gold
summary: A block of raw gold is a raw metal block equivalent to nine raw gold.

title: Java Edition 21w15a
summary: 21w15a is the seventeenth snapshot for Java Edition 1.17, released on April 14, 2021, which adds blocks of raw metal and the ability for goats to ram mobs and armor stands, as well as some reorders of the items in the Creative inventory menu. It also reverts most changes to world generation made in previous snapshots, such as height limit and cave types. Due to the technical challenges on the new cave generations and the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic on the developers, these changes were moved to 1.18.

title: Xbox 360 Edition TU0
summary: TU0 was a version of Xbox 360 Edition released on May 9, 2012. This version is based on Java Edition Beta 1.6.6. The internal build date of this version is March 30, 2012, over a month before release. This was the first version of the Xbox 360 Edition; TU1 was a day-one patch for the console.

title: Minecraft Plus!
summary: Minecraft Plus! is a screensaver app developed by Mojang Studios for April Fools Day 2021. It features many different Minecraft-themed screen savers, using block and item textures from the game, inspired by screensavers from old computers. The app is available to download for free and runs on 64-bit Windows 7+ PCs. Alternatively, the app can also be used in a modern web browser.

Mojang and Play Mechanix announce Minecraft Dungeons Arcade.
March 2, 2021
Minecraft: The Mountain released.
February 24, 2021
Minecraft Dungeons Ancient Hunts and the Flames of the Nether DLC are released.
January 5, 2021
Mojang releases the final update for Minecraft Earth and announces that the game is set to be shut down on June 30, 2021.
December 18, 2020
The new Chills and Thrills event for Minecraft Dungeons launches, lasting until December 30.
December 6, 2020
Mojang Studios announce the Community Celebration event, gifting character creator items and Marketplace maps for free, every day until January 7.

March 9, 2021
Bedrock Edition 1.16.210 released.

Minecraft Dungeons 1.7.3.0 released.

summary:
1.16.220 is a minor update to Bedrock Edition released on April 6, 2021, which fixes bugs.
Development phases contained some of the Caves & Cliffs features through experimental gameplay, which were not included in the full release but became part of 1.17.0 and 1.18.0.

title: Small Dripleaf

title: Big Dripleaf
summary: A big dripleaf is a plant that generates within lush caves. It may be used as a block for parkour and platforming.

summary: Hanging roots are a natural decorative block found underground in the lush caves biome.

title: Moss Carpet
summary: A moss carpet is a thin decorative variant of the moss block.

== 1.16.5 Release Candidate 1 ==
1.16.5 Release Candidate 1 (known as 1.16.5-rc1 in the launcher) is the first and only release candidate for Java Edition 1.16.5, released on January 13, 2021, which addresses two critical stability issues.

summary:
1.16.5 Release Candidate 1 (known as 1.16.5-rc1 in the launcher) is the first and only release candidate for Java Edition 1.16.5, released on January 13, 2021, which addresses two critical stability issues.
This version was reuploaded around an hour later to fix the version being labeled as "1.16.5 Pre-release 1" in game.

title: Minecraft: Norse Mythology (Original Soundtrack)
summary: Minecraft: Norse Mythology (Original Soundtrack) is the fourth soundtrack for Minecraft released by Gareth Coker, which contains music from the Norse Mythology mash-up pack. It was released on December 19, 2017, alongside the Legacy Console Edition update which added said pack.

title: Minecraft: Chinese Mythology (Original Soundtrack)
summary: Minecraft: Chinese Mythology (Original Soundtrack) is the third soundtrack for Minecraft released by Gareth Coker, which contains music from the Chinese Mythology mash-up pack. Originally released as part of the October 4, 2016 update to Legacy Console Edition, the soundtrack was later released on December 21, 2016.

title: Minecraft: Egyptian Mythology Soundtrack
summary: Minecraft: Egyptian Mythology Soundtrack is the fifth soundtrack for Minecraft released by Gareth Coker, which contains music from the Egyptain Mythology mash-up pack. It was released on May 29, 2018, alongside the Legacy Console Edition update which added said pack.

title: Minecraft: Battle & Tumble (Original Soundtrack)
summary: Minecraft: Battle & Tumble (Original Soundtrack) is the second soundtrack released for Minecraft by Gareth Coker, which features music from the Battle and Tumble mini-games. Originally released as part of the June 21, 2016, and August 30, 2016 updates to Legacy Console Edition, the soundtrack was later released on December 21, 2016.

title: Minecraft: Greek Mythology (Original Soundtrack)
summary: Minecraft: Greek Mythology (Original Soundtrack) is the first soundtrack released for Minecraft by Gareth Coker, which features music from the Greek Mythology Mash-up pack. Originally released as part of the July 24, 2015 update to Legacy Console Edition, the soundtrack was later released on December 21, 2016.

title: Dripstone (feature)
summary: Dripstone features can be found commonly in dripstone caves biomes. There are three types of dripstone feature: Large Dripstone, Dripstone Cluster and Pointed Dripstone (aka. Small Dripstone).

title: Redstone mechanics
summary: Redstone mechanics provide Minecraft with a loose analogue to electricity, which is useful for controlling and activating a variety of mechanisms.

title: Java Edition Classic 0.0.14a/Development

It is the last Bedrock version to be released for the Fire Phone.

title: Pocket Edition 1.0.6/Development versions
summary:
This is a list of Pocket Edition 1.0.6 development versions.


== alpha 1.0.6.0 ==
Alpha 1.0.6.0 (also known as 1.0.6 build 1) is a beta build released for 1.0.6 that fixes various issues.


=== Additions ===
The Worlds section has been added to the Store, featuring the Redstone Mansion.


=== Changes ===
In-game messages/changelogs are no longer tied to new updates
The jump range of slimes is now correct


=== Fixes ===
Skeleton horses spawned from traps can now be tamed and ridden
Baby mobs once again make idle sounds
Blocks that are destroyed by the Wither will now drop properly
Arrows fired from a dispenser will now hit entities directly in front of the dispenser
Snow Golem pumpkin heads will now properly scale with Add-Ons
Fixed the 'Cancel' button not appearing when downloading content from the Store without Wi-Fi
Fixed a crash that occurred when changing the storage location of an imported resource pack set to active in Global Resources


== Notes and references ==

title: Community Celebration
summary: Community Celebration was an event that took place between December 8, 2020 and January 13, 2021. During the event, players were able to claim and download four maps made by the community for free, as well as new character creator items, for Bedrock Edition. Players on Java Edition were also able to redeem free content, as well as a free week of Realms. The content was made by community creators PixelHeads, Noxcrew, Gamemode One, Mithey, and Jigarbov Productions. Mojang Studios ran the event in order to thank the community for investing time and talent into the game.

title: Tutorials/Shulker farming
summary:
Shulker farming is the process of using the mechanic where if a shulker is hit by a shulker bullet, there is a chance for a new shulker to form, allowing a renewable source of Shulker Shells.
(From 1.17 - 1.18, this mechanic is only available for Java Edition, but from 1.19 onwards you can farm shulkers on Bedrock Edition.)

title: Azalea tree
summary: An azalea tree is a rare tree that can generate above a lush cave biome, marking the biome's presence aboveground. A variant of the usual oak tree, they extend their roots underground into the cave beneath.

title: Azalea
summary:
An azalea is a solid block that can be grown into an azalea tree.
A flowering azalea is a variant of azalea that, additionally, counts as a flower for all purposes, including pollination by bees, except crafting dyes.

title: Calcite

title: Tuff

title: Budding Amethyst
summary: Budding amethyst is a fragile block found in amethyst geodes that grows amethyst clusters over time. It cannot be obtained as an item or moved by a piston, necessitating that it be returned to in order to harvest more clusters from it.

title: Candle
summary: A candle is a block that comes in any of the sixteen dye colors, as well as an undyed variant. Candles are placed unlit and can be lit with flint and steel to provide light and extinguished by being used. Up to four of the same color of candle can be placed in one block space, which affects the amount of light produced.

title: Block of Amethyst
summary: A block of amethyst is a decorative block crafted from four amethyst shards.

title: Copper Ingot
summary: Copper ingots are metal ingots obtained from smelting raw copper or killing drowned.

title: Minecraft: Builders & Biomes
summary: Minecraft: Builders & Biomes is a board game published by Mojang Studios and Ravensburger. In the game, players explore the Overworld and build structures while defeating hostile mobs, with the goal being to score as many experience points as possible. Players are also allowed to collect blocks and weapons.

title: Tutorials/Spawn-proofing
summary: Hostile mobs spawn in and around your builds at zero light level or if it is night time. Mobs such as creepers have the potential to destroy your creations, while others may attack you. There are many ways of preventing hostile creatures from spawning.

title: Tutorials/Defeating a dungeon
summary: Dungeons are structures that generate underground connected to caves or other generated structures. They contain up to 2 loot chests and a spawner that spawns zombies, skeletons, or spiders. The spawner can be farmed for experience and mob drops and the chests can contain useful and valuable items as well, so they are very good to find.

title: Tutorials/Armor farming
summary: Armor can be farmed via random drops from mobs such as zombies or skeletons, or by trading with villagers. While generally, large amounts of armor aren't required and can be crafted, a farm can be useful for creating decorative armor stands or for visitors in a multiplayer survival world.

title: Brandon Pearce
summary: Brandon "kingbdogz" Pearce is a Mojang Studios employee currently working as a gameplay developer at the headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.

title: Sculk Vein
summary: A sculk vein is a block found in the deep dark or generated by sculk catalysts. It can generate or be placed on any side of a solid block.

title: Sculk Catalyst
summary: A sculk catalyst is a block that converts blocks around it to blocks in the sculk family (except for more sculk catalysts) when a mob that drops experience dies nearby.

summary: This page document the history of the textures of blocks, their additions, changes and removals. Additions and changes made to the models of blocks, as well as any new blocks which reuse prior textures, will not be documented here.

title: Tutorials/Bamboo farming
summary: Bamboo has multiple purposes. Aside from being used as a decoration piece, bamboo can also be used to craft sticks, make scaffolding, bamboo planks/slab/stairs/...‌ and even use it as an alternative fuel source to coal.

summary: This module implements {{Sound table}}.

title: Bedrock Edition guides/Ender Update
summary: This guide is a simplified overview of all the changes in the Ender Update (Bedrock Edition 1.0.x releases), which assumes at least some familiarity with the Boss Update (Bedrock Edition 0.16.x releases).

title: Rooted Dirt
summary: Rooted dirt is a natural decorative block.

title: Spyglass
summary: A spyglass is a tool used to zoom in on distant objects.

title: Deep Dark
summary: The deep dark is a cave biome that generates deep underground in the Overworld.

title: Pointed Dripstone
summary:
Pointed dripstone is a block that makes up stalactites and stalagmites. 
Stalactites (which point downward) can be used as falling projectiles, to renewably drip water and lava into cauldrons and to convert mud into clay. 
Stalagmites (which point upward) deal extra damage to players and mobs that land on them.

title: Minecraft: The Mountain
summary: Minecraft: The Mountain is the seventh Minecraft novel, and the second to be authored by Max Brooks. A sequel to Minecraft: The Island, it was published by Del Rey Books on March 2, 2021. An audiobook was released the same day, with narration provided by Sean Astin. There is also an official free adventure map for Bedrock Edition, made by Blockception, which uses the book as inspiration (available here).

title: Amethyst Cluster
summary:
Amethyst buds are the first three stages of growth of amethyst clusters, which grow on budding amethyst.
Amethyst clusters are the fourth and final growth stage of amethyst buds, which drop amethyst shards when mined.

title: Amethyst geode
summary: An amethyst geode is a feature found in the underground of the Overworld. Amethyst geodes contain smooth basalt, calcite, and are the main source of amethyst items and blocks.

title: Block of Copper
summary: The block of copper and cut copper are blocks that oxidize over time, gaining a verdigris appearance over four stages. They can be prevented from oxidising by being waxed with honeycombs. Non-cut, non-oxidised, non-waxed copper blocks are storage blocks equivalent to nine copper ingots.

title: Copper Ore
summary:
Copper ore is a mineral block found underground.
Deepslate copper ore is the deepslate variant of copper ore, usually found deeper underground.

title: Amethyst Shard
summary: An amethyst shard is a crystal obtained from mining a fully grown amethyst cluster or can be obtained from chests in ancient cities.

title: Bundle
summary: A bundle is a storage item that can be used for managing items inside the player's inventory, and allows for combination of multiple item types within single inventory slots.

title: Bedrock Edition 1.17.0
summary: 1.17.0, the first release of Caves & Cliffs: Part I, is a major update to Bedrock Edition released on June 8, 2021.

title: Dripstone Caves
summary: The dripstone caves biome is an Overworld cave biome filled with clusters and pillars of pointed dripstone and dripstone blocks.

title: Sculk
summary: Sculk is a block found abundantly in the deep dark or converted from other blocks by a sculk catalyst. Like most of the rest of the sculk family it drops experience when broken by a tool that is not enchanted with Silk Touch.

title: Sculk Sensor
summary: The sculk sensor is a sculk block that detects vibrations caused by actions and events and emits a redstone signal and triggers nearby sculk shriekers. Players can sneak to avoid making vibrations and wool can be used to occlude and block them.

title: Glow Berries
summary:
Glow berries are a food item that is collected from cave vines and can be used to plant them.
Cave vines are a plant used to grow glow berries.

title: Warden
summary: The warden is a hostile mob summoned by sculk shriekers in deep dark biomes. It has the highest health and deals the highest melee damage of all mobs. It can also fire ranged sonic boom attacks that bypass blocks and almost all damage-reducing items, including enchanted armor. The warden is completely blind and relies on vibrations and its sense of smell to detect players and mobs to attack.

title: Spore Blossom
summary: A spore blossom is a ceiling-hanging decorative block that emits green particles.

title: Lush Caves
summary: A lush cave is a temperate Overworld cave biome that has a unique fauna and flora and is found underground below azalea trees.

title: Caves & Cliffs
summary: Caves & Cliffs is the name of two major themed updates for Java and Bedrock editions.

title: Commands/fly
summary: Toggles flying.

title: Super Smash Bros. Ultimate
summary: Super Smash Bros.

title: Launcher 2.1.1778x
summary: 2.1.17784 (Windows and Dungeons), 2.1.17783 (macOS), or 2.1.17785 (Linux), was an update to the launcher released on October 20, 2020.

title: Saxs
summary: Saxs is an employee working for Mojang Studios. He is working on Minecraft. He is the Chief Creative Officer for Minecraft Earth.

title: Commands/music
summary: Allows the player to control playing music tracks.

title: Bedrock Edition beta 1.16.100.58
summary: Beta 1.16.100.58 is the ninth beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.16.100, released on September 30, 2020, which adds a new command and fixes bugs.

title: Spawn Egg colors/Java Edition values before 12w01a
Spawn Block
summary: Spawn Block is block that can be used to set the spawn point.

title: Information block
summary: Information block is a block that can be used by the teacher in MinecraftEdu to write text.

title: Tutorials/Quick ways to get food
summary: Eating food is one of the main mechanics in Minecraft. But a player may run out of food when they're out of their base and start starving. This tutorial focuses on some of the fastest ways to get some food.

title: Java Edition history of textures/Blocks
summary: This page attempts to document the full history of the textures of blocks, their additions, changes, and removals. Additions and changes made to the models of blocks and any new blocks that reuse prior textures will not be documented here. Texture files that are completely identical to other texture files will also be largely ignored for the time being.

title: Minecraft Preview
summary:
Minecraft Preview is an app players can use to test out beta features from Bedrock Edition. It works as a separate app, rather than the previous system of opt in beta content inside of the Bedrock Edition game itself. 
As of now, it is currently available for Windows and Xbox, as well as limited users on iOS and iPadOS.

title: Java Edition 1.16.3
summary:
1.16.3 is a minor update to Java Edition released on September 10, 2020, which fixes two bugs.
The content of 1.16.3 is identical to its release candidate, as the only difference between the two is a change in the data and protocol versions.

summary: 1.16.3 Release Candidate 1 (known as 1.16.3-rc1 in the launcher) is the first and only release candidate for Java Edition 1.16.3, released on September 7, 2020, which fixes two bugs.

title: Inventory.png
summary:
inventory.png is a texture file currently used by the game to store the texture of the inventory in survival mode, the recipe book button, and status effect trays.
Prior to Java Edition 1.14, it was a larger texture atlas which contained all icons for status effects.

kz.png is a texture atlas used for storing textures of paintings.

title: Particles.png
summary: particles.png is a texture atlas found inside minecraft.jar that is used to load the majority of the game's particle textures, excluding those derived from other textures. There are also other texture sheets used for other different particles, such as explosion particles.

title: Minecraft Live 2022
summary: Minecraft Live 2022 was a live event held on October 15, 2022, at 16:00 UTC. It announced Java Edition 1.20 and Bedrock Edition 1.20.0, the next update after The Wild Update, and contained a mob vote in which the sniffer won over the other two mobs, the rascal and the tuff golem.

title: Bedrock Edition 1.16.200

title: Andy Hill
summary: Andy 'Needsmoreclever' Hill is a member of the Minecraft and RenderDragon development teams at Mojang Studios. He also hosted the official Minecraft livestreams Join the Club and Casual Friday. He appeared at multiple Minefaire events throughout the US representing Mojang Studios.

title: Tutorials/Defeating a bastion remnant
summary: Defeating a bastion remnant allows the player to obtain lots of loot, including valuable gold items, the Pigstep music disc, and the Snout banner pattern. Due to having magma cube spawners (treasure room bastion variant only), bastion remnants also provide a good source of magma cream. Bastion remnants are one of the toughest and most dangerous structures to beat, so extra care has to be taken to survive. You will see piglins and piglin brutes in the bastion, so be careful.

title: Bedrock Edition 1.16.100

title: Texture atlas
summary: A texture atlas, also known as a spritesheet, is an arrangement of game sprites on a single image file, used by the game to store and access associated sprites more efficiently than with individual files. Minecraft uses both procedurally-generated and predefined texture atlases for different purposes.

summary:

== 2.1.5969 ==
2.1.5969 (Linux) was a launcher beta version released on July 23, 2019, which fixed bugs.


=== Changes ===
Updated translations


== 2.1.760x ==
2.1.7607 (macOS) or 2.1.7608 (Linux) was an update to the launcher.


=== Changes ===
Major improvements to accessibility on Linux.


=== Fixes ===
Fixed technical issues.


== 2.1.761x ==
2.1.7614 (macOS) or 2.1.7613 (Linux) was an update to the launcher.


== 2.1.76xx ==
2.1.7658 (Linux), 2.1.7659 (macOS), or 2.1.7660 (Windows) was an update to the launcher.


=== Additions ===
Added screen reader support on Linux.


=== Changes ===
The launcher can now be used to play the Java Edition demo without a login.
Improved accessibility and screen reader usability.
Launcher window sizing and positioning has been overhauled on all platforms.
Launcher logging improvements: launcher components append to, instead of overwriting, the log.
Launcher can now resume interrupted downloads where applicable.
Display scaling support has been improved on Windows.
Launcher now has better desktop integration on Linux, and can use system dialogs (file browsing and similar).
Linux packages no longer depend on Java 8, instead they require any suitable Java runtime environment.
A dependency on GTK 3 has also been added.
Improved UI performance.


=== Fixes ===
MCL-11253 - Long version names are cut off in the "Edit installation" dropdown
MCL-11440 - Can't edit or delete launcher profiles installed by mod installers
MCL-11958 - While in "Create new Installation" dialog, Version Picking Screen is Blank
MCL-12035 - The new Instalation panel doesn´t let me change the version
MCL-12066 - Minecraft Launcher Game Directory does not know how to cope with a linux file format
MCL-12077 - Cannot launch minecraft on latest beta launcher.

title: Launcher 2.1.596x/Development versions
summary:
This is a list of Launcher 2.1.596x development versions.


== 2.1.547x ==
2.1.5478 (Windows), 2.1.5476 (macOS), or 2.1.5477 (Linux) was a launcher beta version released on June 28, 2019, which fixed bugs.


=== Changes ===
The arrow on drop-downs now dims and moves up a little bit when the drop-down is not being hovered on.
The Help screen now has a link to the Minecraft Launcher Feedback site.
Various small styling improvements.
Updated translations.


=== Fixes ===
Fixed an issue where the multiple game instance warning did not show for profiles that had previously changed folders.
Fixed switch account screen not being scrollable with many accounts added.
MCL-6629 – Launcher floated out of desktop boundaries when taskbar is at the top.
MCL-6544 – Launcher opens up on nonexistent monitor.
MCL-10230 – Erases all launch settings after computer hard-locks.
MCL-11067 – "<language> is x% translated!" popup is never translated.
MCL-11117 – View crash report button does nothing.


== 2.1.55xx ==
2.1.5560 (Windows), 2.1.5559 (macOS), or 2.1.5558 (Linux) was a launcher beta version released on July 3, 2019, which fixed bugs.


=== Changes ===
Added support for Dark mode on OS X.
Updated log window with new styling.
Removed weird pixels from login background image.
Updated translations.


=== Fixes ===
Fixed a bug causing error messages while logging in to immediately disappear.
Fixed a bug in how version file fields for downloads and logging are treated for versions which inherit other versions.
Fixed the downloads field of versions not being treated as optional.
Fixed empty lines sometimes appearing in the launcher log file.
Fixed the drop down arrow in the installation selection sometimes covering up the text.
MCL-8389 - Log output not auto-scrolling.


== 2.1.581x ==
2.1.5819 (Linux), 2.1.5816 (macOS), or 2.1.5815 (Windows) was a launcher beta version released on July 16, 2019, which fixed bugs.


=== Changes ===
More information about how the launcher starts the game is now logged.


=== Fixes ===
MCL-8702 - Launcher black screen - ERROR:gl_surface_egl.cc(711)] eglCreateWindowSurface failed with error EGL_BAD_ALLOC
MCL-10036 - minecraft launcher does not appear on main display if closed on secondary display which is then disconnected before launch
Fixed a bug that meant the log files were missing information on macOS.
Fixed an error where the system language was not properly used by the launcher.
Fixed a bug causing the Launcher Log window to use up performance when open.
Fixed a bug where the --workDir argument did not work on certain systems.


== 2.1.590x ==
2.1.5908 (Linux), 2.1.5907 (macOS), or 2.1.5906 (Windows) was a launcher beta version released on July 22, 2019, which fixed bugs.


=== Fixes ===
MCL-10463 - Minecraft freezing on startup
MCL-10963 - Application Data directory is not changed with --workDir argument
MCL-11268 - Native launcher does not set current working directory correctly when launching the game
MCL-11315 - Relative paths in Game Directory are used twice
MCL-11393 - On startup, the launcher freezes at around 80-90% and then crashes.
MCL-11565 - When I press play the minecraft launcher doesn't load and an error appears: "Game Crashed"
Fixed a bug that caused the game to start with the wrong arguments on some systems.
Fixed a bug that caused the game to start with the wrong directory setting when running with a custom directory.

== 2.1.497x ==
2.1.4976 (Windows), 2.1.4975 (macOS), or 2.1.4974 (Linux) was a launcher beta version released on June 14, 2019, which redesigned the look of the launcher.


=== Additions ===
Layout
The launcher now has a sidebar with tabs to select which game to play, in preparation for the release of Minecraft Dungeons.
Currently only Java Edition can be launched here.
News tab is now located in this sidebar.
Sections
Added "patch notes" tab, which displays the changelog of the latest major version.


=== Changes ===
Appearance
Redesigned the launcher's style.
Launcher now defaults to a size of 984×600px rather than 600×600px.
Tabs
Renamed "Launch options" tab to "Installations".
Launcher versioning information is now located in the Settings menu instead of appearing when clicking the version number displayed in the bottom left.


=== Gallery ===

== 2.1.50xx ==
2.1.5069 (Windows), 2.1.5070 (macOS), or 2.1.5071 (Linux) was a launcher beta version released on June 18, 2019, which updated translations and fixed bugs.


=== Changes ===
Translations
Updated translations.


=== Fixes ===
9 bugs fixed
Fixed problems launching beta versions of Forge.
Fixed patch note link leading to the incorrect page.
Fixed taskbar icon and WM class on linux.
Fixed crash report not showing up immediately if launcher was re-opened on game crash.
Fixed unapproved languages not showing up in the beta launcher.
MCL-10996 – Some languages are not available in the launcher
MCL-11027 – Beta launcher: cannot launch 1.7.10
MCL-11038 – Dropdown arrow moves down when width is too small
MCL-11039 – When on the login screen, pressing tab after entering username selects "?" instead of password field


== 2.1.512x ==
2.1.5127 (Windows), 2.1.5128 (macOS), or 2.1.5129 (Linux) was a launcher beta version released on June 19, 2019, which fixed bugs.


=== Changes ===
Added more logging for connectivity issues.
Enabled selecting of text for copy-paste in various parts of the interface.
Spell checking is now disabled in input fields.
Clicking outside a create/edit installation dialog no longer closes it.
Updated translations.


=== Fixes ===
4 bugs fixed
Fixed animation bug in new installations dialog.
Various accessibility fixes.
Fixed a bug causing the Launcher to start in offline mode despite being online.
MCL-10817 – Crash after fastly closing and restarting the launcher.
MCL-10994 – Some characters are unsupported by the "Play" button font.
MCL-11026 – Beta launcher cannot establish connection to the internet.


== 2.1.519x ==
2.1.5197 (Windows), 2.1.5196 (macOS), or 2.1.5195 (Linux) was a launcher beta version released on June 20, 2019, which fixed bugs.


=== Changes ===
Updated translations.
Reduced the launcher update download size.
Enabled linux versions of the launcher beta.


=== Fixes ===
Fixed being able to resize the launcher window to too small size on Mac and Linux.
Fixed linux versions showing update notifications despite no new versions being available.
Fixed the launcher crashing when reopened quickly after quitting.
Fixed being able to open duplicate instances of Minecraft without seeing a warning message.
Small layout and style fixes.

title: Featured servers/CubeCraft
summary: CubeCraft is a featured Server in the Bedrock Edition. It was introduced in the Better Together Update. The content in CubeCraft focuses on minigames. Currently, there are eight minigames that can be played on this server: EggWars, SkyWars, Survival Games, BlockWars, Lucky Blocks, Skyblock, MinerWare, Battle Arena, Parkour, and the experimental gamemodes. CubeCraft also has a server on Java Edition.

title: Featured servers/Mineplex

title: Darkness
summary: Darkness is a status effect that causes the player's vision to temporarily deteriorate. The effect is caused by the activation of a sculk shrieker, or by being within detection range of a warden.

title: Featured servers/The Hive
summary: The Hive is a Minecraft Featured Server on Bedrock Edition platform. It currently has the highest concurrent player count for Bedrock in history (61,385 as of 2/13/2021). There are currently 20 games, 2 seasonal games and 2 LTM (Limited Time Mode) games. The Hive also had a server on Java Edition until April 15, 2021.

title: Goat Horn
summary: A goat horn is an item dropped by goats. It has eight variants, and each plays a unique sound when used which can be heard by players in a large radius.

title: Mud
summary: Mud is a block found abundantly in mangrove swamps or created by using a water bottle on a dirt block. It can be used for crafting or converted into clay using pointed dripstone.

title: Void start platform
summary: Void start platforms are a feature of 33×33 square of stone with a single block of cobblestone in the center. One can generate at the origin of a Superflat world if in the_void biome.

title: Tutorials/Color palette
summary: A color palette in a architectural construction or design allows the artist to choose a "theme" for their build. The color palette consists of a certain selection of blocks that will often appear on a build.

title: Aquatic
summary: The term Aquatic refers to an in-game group of mobs that live in oceans and rivers and are able to swim.

title: Bedrock Edition beta 1.16.0.54
summary: Beta 1.16.0.54 was an unreleased beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.16.0 developed in either late March or early April of 2020. The beta can be obtained from Google Play store through specific methods.

summary: Beta 1.16.0.52 was an unreleased beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.16.0 developed in mid-March 2020. The beta could previously be obtained from Google Play store.

title: Minecraft: The Shipwreck
summary: Minecraft: The Shipwreck is the sixth Minecraft novel. It is authored by C. B. Lee and was published by Del Rey Books on November 3, 2020. An audiobook was released the same day, with narration provided by Maxwell Glick, David Lee Huynh, and Rebecca Soler.

title: Felix Jones
summary: Felix Jones, whose artistic name is Xilefian ( /ˈzaɪleˌfiːən/ ZY-leh-fee-ən), is a Minecraft game developer at Mojang Studios and the tech lead for Minecraft Bedrock Edition gameplay. He joined the Minecraft team in January 2020.

title: Animation

summary: An NBT path is a descriptive label used to specify a collection of particular elements from an NBT data tree. A path has the general form node.….node, where each node declares what types of sub-elements can be chosen from a previous tag.

title: Tutorials/Bartering farm
summary: Bartering with piglins is a great way for the player to get a lot of items. From gravel to Soul Speed books, many items can be obtained from bartering.

title: Optimize world
summary: The optimize world screen is a game menu that is used to upgrade the level data of a world to the latest format. If the player optimizes a world, it is no longer compatible with previous versions of the game.

title: Java Edition 20w17a
summary: 20w17a is the thirteenth snapshot for Java Edition 1.16, released on April 22, 2020, which added the /attribute command, tweaked bastion remnant loot, and lowered the spawn rate of ruined portals, along with bug fixes.

title: Java Edition pre-Classic rd-131648
summary: rd-131648 is the first unreleased version of Minecraft pre-Classic (then known as Cave Game) created on May 13, 2009. This version was never released to the public, and there isn't any footage either. Despite the fact that the development of Minecraft began some time before this version, older testimonies are not considered separate versions, as they were extremely unstable and, in fact, unplayable.

title: Basalt columns
summary: Basalt columns are vertical clusters of basalt blocks found within basalt delta biomes. They may also contain lava and magma in the many gaps between the towers.

title: Delta
summary: A delta is one-block-deep sheets of constrained lava found among the terrain of basalt deltas biomes.

title: Bedrock Edition beta 1.15.0.8
summary: Beta 1.15.0.8 is the first RenderDragon beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.16.200, released on April 16, 2020, which introduces RenderDragon to the Windows 10 port.

title: Bedrock Edition beta 1.16.0.57
summary: Beta 1.16.0.57 is the ninth beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.16.0, released on April 15, 2020, which adds more Nether Update features, more parity and fixes bugs.

title: Bedrock Edition 1.14.60
summary: 1.14.60 is a minor update to Bedrock Edition released on April 15, 2020, which fixes bugs.

title: Ruined portal
summary: A ruined portal is a naturally generated damaged nether portal, which spawns in both the Nether and the Overworld. It contains some decoration and a loot chest around it.

title: Java Edition 20w16a
summary: 20w16a is the twelfth snapshot for Java Edition 1.16, released on April 15, 2020, which adds bastion remnants, ruined portals, chains, and a new music disc.

title: Java Edition Classic 0.0.19a 02
summary: 0.0.19a_02 was a version of Java Edition Classic released on June 19, 2009, between 23:40 to 23:51 UTC.

title: Lena Raine
summary: Lena Raine (/ˈleɪ.nə/ LAY-nuh or /ˈlɛ.nə/ LEN-uh), also known as Lena Chappelle or kuraine, is a composer, producer, and video game developer who composed tracks for the Nether Update, Caves & Cliffs Part II, and The Wild Update. All of these songs are featured in her albums Minecraft: Nether Update (Original Game Soundtrack), Minecraft:  Caves & Cliffs (Original Game Soundtrack), and Minecraft:  The Wild Update (Original Game Soundtrack). Outside of Minecraft Raine is known for creating the soundtracks of games such as Celeste, Deltarune, Guild Wars 2 and Chicory: A  Colorful Tale.

title: Gilded Blackstone
summary: Gilded blackstone is a variant of blackstone that can drop itself or gold nuggets when mined.

title: Polished Blackstone Bricks
summary:
Polished blackstone bricks are a decorative version of polished blackstone.
 Cracked polished blackstone bricks is the cracked version of polished blackstone bricks.

title: Polished Blackstone
summary:
Polished blackstone is the stone-like polished variation of blackstone.
 Chiseled polished blackstone is the chiseled variation of polished blackstone.

title: Blackstone
summary: Blackstone is a dark-colored block that functions similar to cobblestone or cobbled deepslate. It can be found only in the Nether.

title: Basalt Deltas
summary: The basalt deltas is a volcanic biome situated in the Nether.

title: Java Edition 20w15a
summary: 20w15a is the eleventh snapshot for Java Edition 1.16, released on April 8, 2020, which adds a new Nether biome, new music tracks, new blocks, and other changes and fixes.

title: Permission level
summary:
Permission level is used to describe permissions of a player or a command executor.
For example, in Bedrock Edition, /setmaxplayers can't be executed in a command block, because this command requires executor to have permission of level 3, while command blocks have a permission level of only 1.

title: Footprint
summary: The Footprint was a joke item from Java Edition 20w14∞, found only in the missing dimension.

title: Zoglin
summary: Zoglins are undead hostile mobs created when a hoglin enters the Overworld or End. They attack all mobs (and armor stands) indiscriminately, with the exception of other zoglins and creepers.

title: Bedrock Edition beta 1.16.0.55
summary: Beta 1.16.0.55 is the eighth beta version for Bedrock Edition 1.16.0, released on April 2, 2020, which fixes bugs.

title: Funky Portal
summary: The funky portal is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ that allows entry into randomly generated dimensions. It is a colored variant of the nether portal block with the color being determined by the destination dimension.

title: Swaggiest stairs ever
summary: The swaggiest stairs ever is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ which is the stair variant for the netherite block.

title: Java Edition 20w14a
summary: 20w14a is the tenth snapshot for Java Edition 1.16, released on April 2, 2020, which adds zoglins, makes some changes to striders, and fixes bugs.

title: An Ant
summary: An ant is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ that moves around when placed on top of black or white concrete.

title: Box of Infinite Books
summary: The box of infinite books is a block introduced in Java Edition 20w14∞ that provides a written book containing random text when used. It uses the texture of oak planks on all but one face, on which it has its own bookshelf-like texture randomized based on its location.

title: A Very Fine Item
summary: A very fine item was a joke item from Java Edition 20w14∞, found only in the isolation dimension.

title: Java Edition 20w14∞
summary: 20w14∞ (labeled as 20w14infinite in the launcher, and 20w14~ in game) is an April Fools' joke snapshot, supposedly the first and only snapshot for the "Ultimate Content" update, released on April 1, 2020, which adds new procedurally generated dimensions that randomize existing elements of the game and several ways to access them.

title: Tutorials/How to get a crash report
summary: This tutorial is to help you obtain crash reports generated by Minecraft. Crash reports can help developers confirm and diagnose issues and should be included in bugs on the Bug tracker whenever possible.
