summary: An endermite is the smallest hostile mob. An endermite may spawn when a player throws an ender pearl. They attack by biting the player. Endermen are hostile toward endermites.

title: Realms Plus
summary: Minecraft Realms Plus is an official subscription-based server hosting service that allows players to create and manage their own private Minecraft servers. Hosted by Mojang, Realms Plus provides an easy and fast way to create servers and allows the owner to manage them from inside the game, without prior knowledge of the concepts for hosting on the Internet. Realms Plus also allows players to choose from a list of content curated by Mojang, which is updated approximately every month. Realms Plus is not intended for large public servers, but groups of friends or as a family server.

title: Health Boost
summary: Health Boost is an unused status effect that increases a player's (or mob's) maximum health.

title: Blindness
summary: Blindness is a status effect that impairs the player's vision. It can be cast by illusioners‌ or by consuming suspicious stew.

title: Night Vision
summary: Night Vision is a status effect that enhances the player's ability to see in darkness and underwater.

title: Mining Fatigue
summary: Mining Fatigue is an effect that reduces mining and attack speed, opposite to Haste.

title: Slowness
summary: Slowness is an effect that decreases walking speed.

title: Jump Boost
summary: Jump Boost is a status effect that temporarily increases the jump height of the player.

title: Strength
summary: Strength is an effect which increases attack power.

title: Haste
summary: Haste is a status effect that increases attack speed by 10% per level and increases mining speed by 20% per level. Negative levels decrease mining and attack speed, similar to Mining Fatigue.

It can be obtained only from eating a pufferfish. Drinking milk removes the effect. In Bedrock and Education editions, it can also be cured with tonic.

summary: 14w03b is the fifth snapshot for Java Edition 1.8, and was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 14w03a snapshot.

summary: 14w03a is the fourth snapshot released for Java Edition 1.8.

title: Java Edition 14w02c
summary: 14w02c is the third snapshot for Java Edition 1.8, and was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 14w02a and 14w02b snapshots.

title: Java Edition 14w02b
summary: 14w02b is the second snapshot for Java Edition 1.8, and was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 14w02a snapshot.

title: Java Edition 14w02a
summary: 14w02a is the first snapshot for Java Edition 1.8, and the first snapshot released in 2014.

title: Andesite
summary:
Andesite is a block of igneous rock, most often found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished andesite is the polished version of andesite.

title: Diorite
summary:
Diorite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished diorite is the polished version of diorite.

title: Java Edition 13w42a
summary: 13w42a is the twelfth snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2. It allows for more letters to be put on signs, change the texture of stained glass and makes witches a common monster (like creepers and zombies) instead of spawning exclusively in and around witch huts.

title: Java Edition 13w41b
summary:
13w41b is the eleventh snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2, which was released to fix some of the bugs in the 13w41a snapshot.
13w41b was reuploaded later on October 11, 2013, to fix crashes related to the server icon.

title: Java Edition 13w41a
summary: 13w41a is the tenth snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2 which adds stained glass and their pane variants.

title: Java Edition 13w38c
summary:
13w38c is the seventh snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2, which was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 13w38a and 13w38b snapshots.
13w38c was reuploaded a few minutes after release.

title: Java Edition 13w39b
summary: 13w39b is the ninth snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2, which was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 13w39a snapshot.

title: Java Edition 13w38a
summary: 13w38a was the fifth snapshot released for Java Edition 1.7.2.

title: Java Edition 13w38b
summary: 13w38b is the sixth snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2, which was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 13w38a snapshot.

title: Java Edition 13w37b
summary: 13w37b is the fourth snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2, which was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 13w37a snapshot.

title: Java Edition 13w37a
summary: 13w37a is the third snapshot released for Java Edition 1.7.2.

title: Java Edition 13w36a
summary: 13w36a is the first snapshot released for Java Edition 1.7.2.

title: Java Edition 13w36b
summary: 13w36b is the second snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2, which was released to fix some of the bugs and crashes in the 13w36a snapshot.

title: Java Edition 13w42b
summary: 13w42b is the thirteenth snapshot for Java Edition 1.7.2, which was released to fix some of the bugs in the 13w42a snapshot.

title: Java Edition 1.7.4
summary: 1.7.4 is a minor update to Minecraft (Java Edition) that was released on December 10, 2013.

title: Java Edition 1.8
summary: 1.8, the first release of the Bountiful Update, is a major update to Minecraft. It added and changed many aspects of Minecraft (Java Edition). Among many things, the update made it easier for map makers to create adventure maps, while using the newly added Spectator mode. It added many blocks, mobs, and a structure for Survival play. Many commands were added or extended, the world boundary became a customizable component, many Survival mechanics were changed, and the update gave way for many more world customization options.

title: Slime Block
summary: A slime block is a storage block equivalent to nine slimeballs. It has both sticky and bouncy properties making it useful in conjunction with pistons to move both blocks and entities.

title: Granite
summary:
Granite is a block of igneous rock, found in large pockets in the ground.
 Polished granite is the polished version of granite.

title: Tutorials/End survival
summary: This tutorial will tell the player how to survive in the End after killing the ender dragon.

title: Spawn chunk
summary: Spawn chunks are chunks found at the world spawn point which are always loaded in memory, unlike normal chunks which unload when no players are nearby.

title: Tutorials/Best biomes for homes
summary: One of the most important things to think about when building a shelter is where to put it.

title: Absorption
summary: Absorption is a status effect that pads the health bar with extra hearts.

title: Nether Portal (block)
summary: The nether portal block is the translucent part of the nether portal that teleports the player to and from the Nether.

title: Chicken Jockey
summary: Chicken jockeys are the rare appearance of a baby zombie, baby zombified piglin, baby zombie villager, baby husk, or baby drowned riding a chicken.

title: Fireball
summary: A fireball is an explosive projectile expelled from a ghast as its method of attack.

title: Tutorials/Rube Goldberg machine
summary: A complex redstone device might not be every miner's cup of tea, but a giant chain reaction device can be a quite entertaining thing to build and test, and players can learn a lot from it. On this page are some ideas and tips that could make the machine one to be noticed.

title: Blue Dye
summary: Blue dye is a primary dye color.

title: Bedrock Edition version history/Development versions
summary: Starting on November 22, 2013, Mojang Studios began to publicly release testing versions of full updates to Android users who opt into the beta program, in order to get major feedback, especially for bug reporting.

title: Music
summary: Minecraft contains many music tracks, which play at various points in game, including the main menu, in Creative mode, in the Nether, in the End, and during the credits.

title: Beetroot Seeds
summary:
Beetroot seeds are items that can be used to plant beetroot crops.
Beetroot crops are planted in farmland and used to grow beetroot and beetroot seeds.

title: Beetroot Soup
summary: Beetroot soup is an unstackable food item.

title: Beetroot
summary: A beetroot is a food and dye ingredient.

title: Obsidian wall
summary: Obsidian walls were an experimental and short-lived debugging structure made of obsidian. They were introduced in a version Infdev released on February 27th, 2010 and were removed a short time later.

title: Brick pyramid
summary: Brick pyramids were tall, experimental generated structures made up exclusively of bricks.

title: Ryan Holtz
summary: Ryan Holtz is a former game developer at Mojang Studios who worked on the rendering engine of Minecraft. His employment at Mojang was announced on November 2, 2013 at the "Future of Minecraft" panel at MINECON 2013. His first day at the Mojang office was November 18, 2013.

title: Tomas Sommar
summary: Tomas Sommar is a former web developer who worked at Mojang Studios.

title: Michael Stoyke
summary: Michael "Searge" Stoyke is a game developer working at Mojang Studios. He is currently working on Minecraft. His employment at Mojang was announced on November 2, 2013 at the "Future of Minecraft" panel at MINECON 2013. His first day at the Mojang office was January 2, 2014. He is most well known for founding the Mod Coder Pack. He is the founding member of ModJam and was known for his 'secret feature' game where he adds secret features, mainly command block ones, to the game in secret and waits for users to find them and report them on Twitter. On February 13, 2015, Searge announced on Twitter that the 'secret feature' game would stop when snapshots are released for Java Edition 1.9, claiming that it was getting 'a bit old'.

title: Hampus Nilsson
summary: Hampus Nilsson is the customer support manager at Mojang Studios. He joined the company in January 2013, but assumed the lead role when Marc Watson's job capacity changed.

title: Lisa Kempe
summary: Lisa Kempe is a project manager at Mojang Studios since September 2015. From January 2013 to September 2015, she worked as a customer support agent.

title: Minecraft - Volume Beta
summary: Minecraft - Volume Beta is the second Minecraft soundtrack album by C418, the first being Minecraft - Volume Alpha.

title: Dark oak
summary: A dark oak tree is a variant of the oak tree with a thick trunk. They are found in the dark forest biome.

title: Tutorials/Ultra hardcore survival
summary: If you have played Hardcore mode many times and are comfortable with it, and want an even bigger challenge, try Ultra Hardcore Mode.

title: Forest rock
summary: A forest rock is a feature found throughout old growth taiga biomes.

title: Java Edition Beta 1.7.2
summary: Beta 1.7.2 is a version of Java Edition Beta released on July 1, 2011, to fix some of the bugs and crashes in Beta 1.7_01.

title: The Update that Changed the World
summary: The Update that Changed the World is the name for Java Edition version 1.7.2, a major update released on October 25, 2013.

title: Widget:FileUrl
summary: url()

title: Tutorials/Blaze farming
summary: This tutorial seeks to teach you, the player, how to farm blazes, a mob found in fortresses.

title: Redstone Repeater/DV
summary: Effectively, add the repeater's facing value (0 to 3) to 4×(delay-1). For example, a repeater facing west with a delay of 3 redstone ticks would have a block data value of 3 + 4×(3-1) = 11.

title: Tutorials/Making nice floors
summary: This tutorial shows how to make different types of floorings for buildings.

title: Java Edition 1.7.2
summary:
1.7.2, the first release of The Update that Changed the World, is a major update to Minecraft (Java Edition) released on October 25, 2013, which added many new biomes, new generated structures, new flowers, stained glass, better networking, new commands and more.
A pre-release for 1.7.2 was released earlier on October 25, 2013, though the full release of 1.7.2 is identical to this pre-release.

title: Jonas Mårtensson
summary: Jonas Mårtensson is the chief executive officer of Mojang Studios. He joined the company as vice president on October 2, 2013, when his twin brother and the CEO of Mojang, Carl Manneh, announced his recruitment. With the acquisition of Mojang by Microsoft in November of 2014 and the subsequent retirement of his brother, he assumed the position of CEO.

title: Commands/setblock
summary: Changes a block to another block.

title: Heart of the Sea
summary: A heart of the sea is a rare item that can be crafted into a conduit.

title: Java Edition 13w39a
summary: 13w39a is the eighth snapshot released for Java Edition 1.7.2.

title: Minecart with Command Block
summary: A minecart with command block is an impulse‌ or repeating‌ command block inside a minecart.

title: Java Edition data values/Pre-flattening/Entity IDs
summary: Note: All eggs listed above are available in Creative mode. When an egg with any other entity ID is created, or if the entity does not have a specific egg listed above, the egg will have the correct name, but it will be colored gray () and no mob will spawn when the egg is used.

title: Java Edition data values/Pre-flattening/Item IDs
summary: All items have values above 255, making it easy to separate the Block IDs from the Item IDs.

title: Tutorials/Wither skeleton farming
summary: A wither skeleton farm is a mob grinder that involves creating a spawning pad inside a nether fortress, while removing all other mob spawning points nearby.

title: Commands/tellraw
summary: Sends a JSON message to players.

title: Shaders
summary: Shaders are used to define the game's rendering of certain elements.

title: Java Edition 1.6.4
summary: 1.6.4 is a minor update to Minecraft (Java Edition) released on September 19, 2013, which fixed a bug where structures would not save with the world file.

title: Shaders/Before 1.9
summary: Shaders are a feature used for various effects in Spectator Mode when the player takes the viewpoint of a mob.

title: Tutorials/Fish farming
summary: Fish farming is an easy method of catching large quantities of fish and other items (junk and treasure) by fishing. Most AFK (away from keyboard) designs involve right-clicking an iron door with tripwire above it, causing fish caught to flow into a hopper and then into a collection chest.

title: Water Breathing
summary: Water breathing is a status effect that prevents or delays drowning, and allows waterlogged beds‌ to be used. It also prevents or delays squid, glow squid, salmon, cod, pufferfish, tropical fish, and tadpoles from taking suffocation damage from being on land.‌

title: Luck of the Sea
summary: Luck of the Sea is an enchantment to a fishing rod that increases luck while fishing.

title: Acacia
summary: The acacia tree is found in the savanna biome. Acacia trees are around 8 blocks tall and feature distinct diagonal trunks, and may occasionally have multiple canopies.

title: Lure
summary: Lure is a fishing rod enchantment that decreases the wait time for a bite on the hook.

title: Tutorials/Programs and editors/NBTExplorer
summary: NBTExplorer is a low-level graphical NBT (Named Binary Tag) data editor for Minecraft. With a directory-tree interface for easily exploring multiple worlds, and support for the latest NBT standard, NBTExplorer is built on top of Substrate. Almost all things in a map in any Minecraft version is built with NBT, so you can usually change the datas for the newest version without updating NBTExplorer.

title: Dark Forest
summary: A dark forest is a temperate forested biome. It is known for its thick, dense leaf canopies that block light sufficiently to allow hostile mobs to spawn during the daytime.

title: Snowy Taiga
summary: A snowy taiga is a snow-covered biome that comprises a forest of spruce trees, ferns and large ferns, usually generating adjacent to or within snowy plains.

title: Biome/Before 1.18
summary: In Java Edition 1.18 and Bedrock Edition 1.18.0, Overworld terrain generation was rewritten to become more varied and independent of biome generation. This made many biome variants that were in the game redundant, as the only difference between their regular counterparts was the way terrain generated in them. As a result, most variant biomes were removed from the generator. In Java Edition, these biomes were merged with their normal variants, while in Bedrock Edition, these biomes still exist, but remain unused.

title: Birch Forest
summary: A birch forest is a lush temperate biome, usually generating near other lush biomes. There are two variants in the biome family.

title: Snowy Plains
summary: The snowy plains is a snow-covered grassland biome in the Overworld that usually generates near other snowy biomes.

title: Tutorials/Command NBT tags
summary: NBT tags can be specified for items and entities created with the /give and /summon commands.

title: Coarse Dirt
summary: Coarse dirt is a variation of dirt on which grass block cannot spread.

title: Badlands
summary: The badlands, formerly and commonly referred to as the mesa biome, are uncommon warm biomes, featuring mounds of terracotta, coming in various colors. There are three different variants of the badlands biome.

title: Commands/summon
summary: Summons an entity.

title: Savanna
summary: The savanna is a common warm biome. It typically generates bordering a desert, forest or plains biome, and has three variations total. It is a flat, low-elevation plain with scattered trees. Villages and pillager outposts may generate here.

title: Salmon
summary: Salmon are common passive aquatic mobs found in oceans and rivers. They are a reliable and nutritious source of early-game food when cooked.

title: Amplified
summary: Amplified, stylized in-game as AMPLIFIED, is a world type with a large range of altitude used in Overworld terrain generation.

title: Tropical Fish
summary: Tropical Fish are common passive mobs found in oceans, mangrove swamps and lush caves. There are 2,700 naturally occurring variants. Using commands, up to 3,104 visually distinct variants can be spawned.

title: Pufferfish
summary: Pufferfish are passive mobs found in oceans. They defend themselves by dealing damage and inflicting Poison to nearby players (if not in Peaceful difficulty‌) and certain mobs.

title: Cooked Salmon
summary: Cooked salmon is a food item obtained by cooking raw salmon.

title: Raw Salmon
summary: Raw salmon is a food item that can be eaten by the player or cooked to make cooked salmon.

title: Packed Ice
summary: Packed ice is an opaque solid block variant of ice. Unlike regular ice, it does not melt near bright  light sources.

title: Nether Wastes
summary:
See also: Hell
The Nether wastes is the most common biome found in the Nether.

title: PlayStation Vita Edition
summary: Minecraft: PlayStation Vita Edition is the Legacy Console Edition version of Minecraft for the PlayStation Vita and PlayStation TV in development by 4J Studios for and alongside Mojang Studios.

title: PlayStation 3 Edition
summary: Minecraft: PlayStation 3 Edition is the PlayStation 3 edition of Minecraft, developed by 4J Studios for Mojang Studios.

title: PlayStation 4 Edition
summary: Minecraft: PlayStation 4 Edition is the Legacy Console Edition version of Minecraft developed by 4J Studios and Mojang Studios for the PlayStation 4.

title: Tutorials/Comparator update detector
summary: A comparator update detector or CUD switch is a redstone mechanism that exploits a feature in the game in order to detect comparator updates.

title: Yggdrasil
summary: Yggdrasil is the name of the authentication system that is currently used for authenticating user credentials for Minecraft.

title: Tutorials/Nether hub
summary: Often, players in the Overworld have good reason to travel thousands of blocks from one place to another, costing both time and resources. In these situations, the Nether can be used to significantly reduce the length of a journey. This is due to the fact that coordinates in the Overworld are 8x the value of the coordinates in the Nether, meaning that every one block traveled in the Nether translates to eight blocks traveled in the Overworld.

title: Tutorials/Endless circling pool
summary: An endless circling pool, also known as an AFK pool, allows the player or any player-sized mob that gets in the water to circle endlessly around the center. These are commonly used for AFK players in multiplayer to avoid getting kicked off the server.

title: Old Growth Taiga
summary: Old growth taigas are cold forested biomes covered with tall spruce trees. There are two variants in the biome family.

title: Podzol
summary: Podzol is a dirt-type block that naturally blankets the surface of the old growth taiga and bamboo jungles, along with their respective variants. Grass blocks and mycelium cannot spread to this block.

title: Tutorials/Mining/Glass rooms
summary: Glass-room base.

title: Tutorials/Mining/Offset Tunnels
summary: All are side views, end-on to the tunnels.

title: Tutorials/Custom Minecraft directory
summary:
To play Minecraft from a custom directory, you can use these simple steps.
If you have anything important in your Minecraft folder, it is strongly recommended you make a backup before moving it!

title: Tutorials/Creating a village
summary: Villagers are useful passive mobs. Players can get items that are normally hard to obtain (like enchanted diamond armor) or downright impossible (bottle o' enchanting) via trading with villagers using emeralds as currency. However, finding a village with live villagers can sometimes be difficult, but there is a simple solution - to make your own village.

title: MINECON 2013
summary:
MINECON 2013 was held in Orlando, Florida from November 2 to 3.
Official Tumblr: https://mineconorlando.tumblr.com/.

The song "One" from C418's soundtrack from the Story of Mojang documentary was the song embedded in the 2013 site.

title: Tommaso Checchi
summary: Tommaso Checchi (/ˈkɛkˌki/ KEHk-kee) is a former member of the Minecraft Redmond team.

title: Experience/Before 12w23a
summary: A chart which details the experience per level and cumulative experience more accurately is available here: Detailed Enchanting Experience Chart (last updated 7/3/12)

title: Java Edition data values
summary: These data values refer to the different types of blocks, items and other features on Java Edition and are used in many places in Minecraft. Block IDs are used to define blocks placed in the world. Item IDs are valid only for items (including items in chests and items dropped in the world). All block IDs that do not have a gray background in this page are also valid item IDs. There are also entity IDs for entities such as mobs and projectiles.

title: Jumping
summary: Jumping is a mechanic that elevates the player 1 1⁄4 block into the air. It also has other effects when combined with another forms of movement.

title: Game rule
summary: Game rules are a set of customizable options for a specific in-game world.

title: Tutorials/Adding beauty to constructions
summary: This tutorial is to give aesthetic advice for your home or building. The beauty in exterior design can come from many different elements all interacting together. No matter what architectural style or color scheme you choose, the most important aspect of exterior design is adding details. This means that if you're building a blue colonial style home, you want to make sure to use different shades of blue blended together, maybe with another color as an accent. Try not to make your build look like a box. People may not always agree with your style, but attention to detail is undeniable.

title: Horse Update
summary: The Horse Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.6.1 (or 1.6), a major update released on July 1, 2013.

title: Tutorials/Egg farming/Compact Pit Egg Farm
summary: Chickens go over the hopper, and eggs will accumulate in the chest.

title: Tutorials/Egg farming/Egg Farm 12
summary: The lightened half of the chest is optional, and the downward-facing dropper should be loaded with any disposable items.  The access tunnel can enter anywhere on the lower left.

title: Xbox One Edition
summary: Minecraft: Xbox One Edition is the Legacy Console Edition version of Minecraft developed by 4J Studios and Mojang Studios for the Xbox One.

title: Redstone circuits/Miscellaneous/analog 16-rng
summary: The droppers all have one stackable item and one non-stackable item. The numbered hoppers have 2 1⁄2 stacks for power level 8, 1 1⁄4 stacks for power level 4, 1⁄2 stack for power level 2, and 1 64-stackable item for power level 1.

title: Redstone circuits/Clock/Rail clock C
summary: This works best for a longer clock repeat rate.

title: Redstone circuits/Clock/Rail clock B
summary: This works best for a faster clock repeat rate.

title: Redstone circuits/Clock/Rail clock A
summary: This works best for a more compact clock. It will work for a slow or fast repeat rate, depending on how you want it.

title: Jukebox/DV
summary: The associated block entity is used to identify which record has been inserted.

title: Redstone circuits/Memory/TFF Grizdale
summary: [Schematic Help]

title: Attribute
summary: Attributes are a system of buffs/debuffs that are properties on mobs and players. Attributes also have modifiers that adjust the strength of their effect.

title: Enchanted Golden Apple
summary: An enchanted golden apple (in Java Edition) or enchanted apple (in Bedrock Edition), is a rare, uncraftable variant of the golden apple that grants much more powerful effects when consumed.

title: Sand
summary:
Sand is a gravity-affected block found abundantly in deserts and beaches, and less commonly in or near surface water.
 Red sand is a variation of sand found exclusively in the badlands.

title: Tutorials/Settlement guide
summary: This tutorial is for building a settlement (i.e. village, town, city). This is different to the "Building a Metropolis" tutorial, as it is a guide to give you some ideas on how to classify different types of settlements, as well as what goes in each type. Also, it covers other aspects and focuses more on a modern-day setting.

title: Cake
summary:
Cake is a food and a block that can be eaten by the player.
A cake with candle is a light-producing variation created when a candle is used on an uneaten cake.

title: Block of Coal
summary: A block of coal is a storage block, equivalent to nine coal, that can also be used as fuel.

title: Tutorials/Cobblestone farming/Factory V3 Piston CSG
summary: This quad-pillar generator fits in a 4×3 hole, 6 deep.

title: Terracotta
summary: Terracotta is a block that comes in the sixteen dye colors (except with a brownish tint), as well as an undyed variant. It is found abundantly in badlands biomes, or can be obtained by smelting clay.

title: Tutorials/Iron golem farming
summary: Iron golem farming uses village mechanics to produce iron and poppies. Usually, an iron golem farm is a player-constructed village in which golems are spawned and then either killed immediately or moved to a holding cell outside the village boundary for later killing. Iron golem farming is preferable to other methods of iron farming from zombies and skeletons due to a much higher chance of iron dropping and therefore much higher quantities of iron.

title: Name Tag
summary: A name tag is an item used to name mobs in the world and prevent them from despawning naturally.

title: Tutorials/Cobblestone farming/Basic Piston CSG
summary: Design A takes the basic core and adds a piston driven by a simple clock.

title: Bedrock Edition unused features
summary: Since the beginning of Minecraft's development, there have been a number of features added to the game that has little to no actual use. Some of these features are leftovers from removed features, or simply placeholders for new features in future updates.

title: Tutorials/Cobblestone farming/Basic Fountain CSG
summary: Design D is a more complex construction, which begins with an 8×5 wall with a 4×4 pool at the base.  It uses a total of 80 blocks, 4 buckets of water, and 2 buckets of lava.  The obsidian is optional, but using obsidian instead of other blocks helps prevent accidentally mining through the back wall.  Place the water after building, and the lava last of all.  (For the adventurous, a fair bit of the back wall could be removed after building the other blocks off it.)  The building and use of this design is demonstrated in this video.  The finished design will produce two blocks of cobblestone at a time, and when mined, those will fall into the water and be washed towards the player.

title: Tutorials/Cobblestone farming/From Below CSG
summary: This design is in fact a midsize building, 9×7×7 or so, with the generator proper on the roof.

title: Zombie Horse
summary: A zombie horse is an unused variant of the regular horse.

title: Tutorials/Architectural terms
summary: This page explains the definition for a variety of terms used when building in Minecraft. This is not a comprehensive list; only those terms which are usable for features at normal Minecraft scales will be covered.

title: Tutorials/Cobblestone farming/Basic CSGs
summary: Notes about the schematics here:  Stone brick indicates "any block", while gold blocks indicate opaque blocks (relevant to redstone).

title: Taming
summary: Taming is a game mechanic that allows the player to domesticate and tame a wild mob.

title: Horse Saddle
summary: Horse saddles were items which allowed the player to ride horses.

title: Lead
summary: Leads are tools used to leash and lead passive and neutral animals, golems and some monsters.

title: Horse Armor
summary: Horse armor is a special type of armor that can be given to a horse to wear.

title: Carpet
summary: Carpets are thin variants of wool that can be dyed in any of the 16 colors.

title: Reserved6
summary: reserved6 is an unused former placeholder block.

title: Aleksandra Zając
summary: Aleksandra 'MissMarzenia' Zając is a project manager at Mojang Studios since September 2015. From April 2013 to September 2015, she was a customer support agent.

title: Tutorials/Roof decorations
summary: Every part of a roof can be decorated. Here are some of the more common embellishments.

title: Tutorials/Curved roofs
summary: To get a roof that looks curved in Minecraft, you should generally expect to work on quite a large scale. If the curve radius is less than about six meters, the roof will tend to look like a normal pitched roof with a strange mixture of pitches. At smaller scales, it is easier to correctly interpret a dome structure as curved, but other curves may not even be recognizable.

title: Tutorials/Roof types
summary: This tutorial lists many common roof types, roughly in ascending order of complexity, and gives examples of each one.

title: Tutorials/Roof construction guidelines
summary: This tutorial will give you some basic guidelines when building a roof.

title: Entity format
summary: Entities are stored in the entities folder of respective dimension folders. It is stored like regional Minecraft Anvil files, which are named in the form r.x.z.mca.

title: Tutorials/Door-based iron golem farming
summary: This tutorial describes iron golem farming as it works in the Legacy Console Edition (and as it formerly worked prior to Java Edition 1.14 and Bedrock Edition 1.11). These farms are based on the number and arrangement of doors and number of villagers, taking advantage of the fact that if a player creates enough "houses," which can be made with just a door and a block, iron golems can spawn. This tutorial describes door-based farms. For iron golem farming in Java and Bedrock editions, see Tutorials/Iron golem farming.

title: Horse
summary: Horses are passive mobs that can be ridden when tamed and saddled.

title: Java Edition 2.0
summary: On April 1, 2013, Mojang released a hoax announcement for Minecraft 2.0, a new game they had supposedly been working on for two years, describing how it would "bring blocky simulation games to the next level." The post also contained a changelog comprised mostly of nonsensical changes, such as a new slab of TNT called the Etho slab, and the addition of coal blocks (which did not exist at the time).

title: Java Edition pre-Classic
summary: Pre-Classic is the name given to the prototype versions of Minecraft (what is now Java Edition)  developed before Classic. It was the very first development phase of the game, lasting for less than a week; very early development of Minecraft started around May 10 or May 11 and ended on May 16, 2009. The phase was originally named "Cave Game" until the game was changed to "Minecraft: Order of the Stone" then finally to "Minecraft".

title: Tutorials/Magma cube farming
summary: This tutorial will teach the player how to build a magma cube farm. They can often be difficult to make, partially because of the fact that water cannot be placed in the Nether without commands.

title: Redstone components
summary: Redstone components are the blocks used to build redstone circuits.

title: Tutorials/Ice farming
summary: Ice farming is the process of controllably and renewably generating ice, to gather it with a Silk Touch-enchanted tool. Ice naturally occurs in snowy and cold biomes, and ice farming relies on the freezing of water from an infinite water source.

title: Java Edition 13w01a
summary: 13w01a is the first snapshot released for Java Edition 1.5, and the first snapshot released in 2013.

title: Martin Odhelius
summary: Martin Odhelius is a former web developer working at Mojang Studios from January 2013 to March 2017.

title: Linn Hultman
summary: Linn Hultman is the former office manager of Mojang Studios. She was initially hired by Markus Persson to be his personal assistant. Her work ended with Mojang at the start of 2014.

title: Poi Poi Chen
summary: Poi Poi Chen is a former artist who worked for Mojang Studios, specializing in 2D design. She worked on artwork for Scrolls until the development of the title ceased in June of 2015. Since leaving Mojang, she has returned to school to pursue a career in either programming or bio-medicine.

title: Tutorials/Defeating the wither
summary: The wither is one of the two bosses in Minecraft, along with the ender dragon.

title: Amir Moulavi
summary: Amir Moulavi is the former Minecraft Realms lead developer at Mojang Studios.

title: Tutorials/Multiplayer PvP bases
summary: A server with a factions plugin installed is quite different to play than almost any other server.

title: MCUpdate
summary: MCUpdate is a Tumblr blog that hosted Minecraft version changes and updates for the old launcher client.

title: Realms
summary: Minecraft Realms is an official subscription-based server hosting service that allows players to create and manage their own private Minecraft servers. Hosted by Mojang, Realms provides a simple way to create servers and allows the owner to manage them from inside the game, without knowledge of hosting on the internet. In Java Edition, Realms also allow players to choose from a list of minigames to play temporarily, as well as several pre-made world templates, adventure maps, experience maps, and inspiration maps, all made by Realms community map makers. Maps on Java Edition are updated by Mojang sporadically, ranging from a few days to as recently as one to two months. Realms are not intended for large public servers, but for groups of friends or as a family server.

summary: Provides help/lists of commands.

summary: This page will teach the player how to install a Forge server.

title: Hay Bale
summary: Hay bales are storage blocks equivalent to nine pieces of wheat. They are used as a crafting ingredient, to feed llamas, horses and horse variants, reduce fall damage or extend campfire smoke.

title: Tutorials/Survival in an infinite desert
summary: This is a tutorial on survival in an infinite desert, whether that's a Buffet world customized with the desert as the only biome, or a Superflat world customized with the Desert Preset, or a Large Biomes world, where you just happened to spawn in the middle of a large desert.

title: Tutorials/Things not to do
summary:
The Minecraft community has developed some standards of gaming to help new Minecraft players become comfortable with the game. Millions of users have at some point been too inefficient or died unnecessarily. Therefore, a collected list of things the player should not do or forget has been compiled below in order to make the game experience as enjoyable as possible. However, making mistakes is an important step to learn the way of things in Minecraft, so don't feel bad if you follow these suggestions and still make a mistake. In a way, this tutorial acts as a collection of frequent Minecraft mistakes. 
Regardless of the advice given here, players should feel free to ignore any advice and play the game in their own way.

title: Mojam
summary: The Humble Bundle Mojam was an annual charity event in which the Mojang Studios team and other developers create a series of collections ("bundles") of video games that are sold and distributed online at a price determined by the purchaser. Sales of bundles are split between the developers/creators, the Humble Bundle operators, and one or more charities including Child's Play, the Electronic Frontier Foundation, charity: water, and the American Red Cross, with the buyer able to set the revenue split between these groups.

title: Village/Structure (old)
summary: Here are given fuller descriptions and pictures of the various structures that could be found in a village before the Village & Pillage Update.

title: Tutorials/Automatic smelting
summary: The purpose of this tutorial is to teach how to smelt items automatically, without having to put them in and get them out manually.

title: Stonecutter
summary: The stonecutter is used to craft stone and copper related blocks in smaller and more precise quantities than crafting, and is more efficient than crafting for certain recipes. It also serves as a stone mason's job site block.

title: Scoreboard
summary: The scoreboard system is a complex gameplay mechanic utilized through commands. Mainly intended for mapmakers and server operators, scoreboards are used to track, set, and list the scores of entities in a myriad of different ways.

title: Weapon
summary: Weapons are items that can be used to damage entities.

title: Crafting/Dye
summary: In Bedrock and Education editions, lapis lazuli, bone meal, and ink sacs, singly or in any combination, can be substituted for blue dye, white dye, and black dye, respectively, in any recipe. These substitutions are not shown in the recipes given here. Substitution must be total: You cannot use a combination of lapis lazuli and blue dye in the same recipe, for example.

title: Dropper
summary: A dropper is a low-capacity storage block that can eject its contents into the world or into other containers when given a redstone signal.

title: Commands/testfor
summary: Counts entities (players, mobs, items, etc.) matching specified conditions.

title: Minecart with Hopper
summary: A minecart with hopper is a hopper inside a minecart. Unlike a normal hopper it pulls items from containers much more quickly, cannot push items into containers and can collect item entities through a single layer of solid blocks.

title: Tutorials/Hopper
summary: The hopper is a redstone component that can be used to manage items.

title: Java Edition 1.4.7
summary: 1.4.7 is a minor update to Minecraft (Java Edition) that was released on January 9, 2013, to fix some of the bugs and crashes in 1.4.6.

title: Activator Rail
summary: An activator rail is a type of rail that can "activate" certain minecarts.

summary:
Modmemc is a minecraft launcher, There you can Install mods and add modpacks.
Download it Here

title: Block of Quartz
summary: A block of quartz is a mineral block used for decoration. It can be turned into a chiseled quartz block, quartz pillar or quartz bricks.

title: Minecart with Monster Spawner
summary: Minecarts with monster spawners are a combination of both minecarts and monster spawner.

title: Minecart with TNT
summary: A minecart with TNT is a block of TNT inside a minecart. Unlike normal TNT it can detonate instantly under certain conditions and its damage and blast radius is increased by its speed when it detonates.

title: Easter eggs
summary: An Easter egg is an intentional hidden message, inside joke, or feature in a work such as a computer program, web page, video game, television program, movie, book, or crossword. Minecraft features several Easter eggs hidden in the game.

title: Daylight Detector
summary:
A daylight detector is a block that outputs a redstone signal based on sunlight.
Using it inverts it, causing it instead to output a redstone signal based on the darkness of the sky.

title: Info update
summary: info_update and info_update2 are debugging/placeholder blocks exclusive to Bedrock Edition that generated in place of blocks that are not yet added.

title: Hopper
summary: A hopper is a low-capacity storage block that can be used to collect item entities directly above it, as well as to transfer items into and out of other containers.

title: Trapped Chest
summary: A trapped chest functions as a normal chest for item storage, but it produces redstone power when opened. It can be visually distinguished from normal chests by a red coloration around the latch.

title: Nether Quartz
summary: Nether quartz is a white mineral found in the Nether.

title: Nether Quartz Ore
summary: Nether quartz ore is ore found in the Nether, and is a source of quartz.

title: Block of Redstone
summary: A block of redstone is a mineral block equivalent to nine redstone dust. It acts as a permanently powered redstone power source that can be pushed by pistons.

title: Options.txt
summary: options.txt is the file that stores all the options changeable in the in-game options menu and various other information the game needs to store after quitting. It is found in the .minecraft folder in Java Edition or in the com.mojang/minecraftpe folder in Bedrock Edition, and can be edited with any basic text editor to change options. Most settings can be changed in-game, but a few can be changed only by editing this file. The options.txt file for the latest version of the game is not backward-compatible with older versions of the game.

title: Emerald
summary: Emeralds are rare minerals that are used primarily as the currency for trading with villagers and wandering traders. Naturally-occurring emeralds are rarer than diamonds.

summary:

I came across the original Herobrine creepypasta on /v/ and immediately liked it.

summary: So like I touched on earlier I first streamed on EmasVidyaStream, but we left and started our own stream called "Brocraft".

title: Tutorials/Programs and editors/Magic Launcher
summary: Magic Launcher is a 3rd party program that allows easy access to Mojang news, as well as an easy way to tweak settings and quickly install modifications.

title: Apple
summary: Apples are food items that can be eaten by the player.

title: Thorns
summary: Thorns is an armor enchantment that causes attackers to be damaged when they deal damage to the wearer.

title: Tutorials/Building micro shelters
summary: A micro shelter is a compact shelter that fits a large amount of utilities in a minimal amount of space. It can be built very quickly, and requires very few supplies to build.

title: Java Edition 1.4.6
summary: 1.4.6 is an update to Minecraft (Java Edition) that was released on December 20, 2012.

title: Firework Star
summary: Firework stars are items used to determine the color, effect, and shape of firework rockets.

title: Enchanted Book
summary: An enchanted book is an item that lets players add enchantments to certain items using an anvil.

title: Server/Requirements/Dedicated
summary: It should be noted that these suggestion presume default settings in server.conf - i.e., a Draw Distance no higher than 10, and is also based on a new world; the bigger the world gets, especially if there's advanced redstone circuitry at work, the requirements - especially the RAM, or in the case of lots of redstone or mobs (in e.g. grinders), the CPU - increase significantly (to the point where a major world with several camps, redstone machinery, grinders, etcetera can easily more than double the requirements).

title: Server/Requirements/Server
summary:
Since Minecraft rarely uses more than one thread, consider possible waste when buying more than 2 cores. However this does not apply to mods and plugins which utilize their own threads - buy accordingly. Assume that most of the server's load will be on a single core. The main performance factor is without a doubt CPU clock speed. CPU cache sizes and RAM latency are also factors. There does not appear to be a disadvantage to using high-end desktop processors.(verify?)
It should be noted that these suggestion presume default settings in server.conf - i.e., a Draw Distance no higher than 10, and is also based on a new world; the bigger the world gets, especially if there's advanced redstone circuitry at work, the requirements - especially the RAM, or in the case of lots of redstone or mobs (in e.g. grinders), the CPU - increase significantly (to the point where a major world with several camps, redstone machinery, grinders, etcetera can easily more than double the requirements).

title: Server/Requirements
summary: This page lists the server requirements of the current Java Edition version, 1.19.3.

title: Firework Rocket
summary: A firework rocket is an item (and entity) used for creating decorative explosions, boosting when flying with elytra, and loading into a crossbow as ammunition.

title: Vu Bui
summary:
Vu Bui is the Chief Content Officer of Mojang Studios and has been since October 2012.
He is of Vietnamese descent.

title: Windswept Hills
summary: Windswept hills are uncommon cold biomes that mainly generate in hilly terrain. There are three variants in the biome family.‌

title: Tutorials/Squid farming
summary: Collecting ink sacs can prove quite time-consuming. To save time, a squid farm could be made to automatically gather ink sacs for your collection later on. There are two main ways to do it. The first is to dig a tunnel underneath the ocean; the second is to make a man-made lake, or find a shallow pre-existing lake.

title: Java Edition 12w49a
summary: 12w49a is the first snapshot for Java Edition 1.4.6, released on December 7, 2012, which added nether brick slabs, enchanted books and fireworks.

title: Dimension
summary: Dimensions are accessible realms within a Minecraft world characterized by a way of generation, biomes and structures, and other things unique to one dimension.

title: Redstone Comparator
summary: A redstone comparator is a redstone component used to maintain, compare, or subtract signal strength, or to measure certain block states (primarily the fullness of containers).

title: Java Edition 1.5
summary: 1.5, the first release of the Redstone Update, is a major update to Minecraft (Java Edition), released on March 13, 2013, which added a number of new redstone-related blocks and a new decorative block – the block of quartz.

title: Redstone Update

title: Nether Reactor Core

summary: Glowing obsidian is an unobtainable decorative block that emits light.

title: Nether reactor

title: Invisibility
summary: Invisibility is a status effect that turns entities invisible. It has one potency level (active), but its duration can be extended.

title: Redstone circuits/Pulse
summary: A pulse circuit is a redstone circuit which generates, modifies, detects, or otherwise operates on redstone pulses.

title: Redstone circuits/Transmission
summary: A transmission circuit is a redstone circuit that allows redstone signals to move from one place to another.

summary: This article covers types of circuits with insufficient content to justify their own articles.

summary: items.png was a texture atlas found inside minecraft.jar that was used to load the game's item textures.

title: Tutorials/Crop farming
summary: Crop farming allows players to plant any of several vegetables and other crops on farmland, which then grow over time and can be harvested for food. This page covers four separate crops, all of which share essentially the same growth mechanics, though they produce different crops. All four seeds need to grow to maturity to produce more crops.

title: Tutorials/Flower farming
summary: Flowers are useful for decoration, dyes, and breeding rabbits and bees.

title: Anvil
summary: An anvil is a block that allows players to repair items, rename items, and combine enchantments.

title: Java Edition 1.1
summary: 1.1 is a major update to Minecraft (Java Edition) released on January 12, 2012, which adds spawn eggs, support for multiple languages, the Superflat world type, and beaches. It is the first update to begin using snapshots, and to add 56 languages, and the first major release that did not introduce any new blocks. There were no minor versions to 1.1.

title: Java Edition 1.3.1
summary: 1.3.1 is a major update to Java Edition released on August 1, 2012, which added trading, adventure mode, new generated structures (jungle and desert pyramids) and new blocks/items including emeralds, book and quills, written books, and tripwire.

title: Java Edition 1.3.2
summary:
1.3.2 is a minor update to Java Edition released on August 16, 2012, to fix some of the bugs and crashes in Java Edition 1.3.1.
A pre-release version of 1.3.2 was released on August 14, 2012, for players to test, though the full release of 1.3.2 is identical to this pre-release.

title: Jonatan Pöljö

title: Mushroom Fields
summary: Mushroom fields, commonly referred to as mushroom islands, are rare biomes which always generate as islands surrounded by deep oceans. They are the only place in the game where mycelium and mooshrooms are found, and have the special property that no hostile mobs normally spawn in these biomes.

title: Swamp hut
summary: Swamp huts (also known as witch huts) are small generated structures that have the ability to spawn witches and black cats.

title: Teleportation
summary: Teleportation is a form of transportation in which the moving object is instantaneously moved to its target location.

title: Bat
summary: A bat is a flying ambient passive mob that spawns in dark areas underground.

title: Resource pack
summary: The resource pack system provides a way for players to customize textures, models, music, sounds, languages, texts such as the end poem, splashes, credits, and fonts without any code modification.

title: Witch
summary: A witch is a hostile mob that uses harmful splash potions as ranged weapons and positive potions on itself.

title: Lava Spawner
summary: The lava spawner was a block that would repeatedly create lava on each of its four orthogonal sides.

title: Carrot
summary:
A carrot is a food item obtained from carrot crops that can be used to plant them, eaten or used as a crafting ingredient.
Carrot crops are planted in farmland and used to grow carrots.

title: Nikolaj Nyholm
summary: Nikolaj Nyholm is a Danish entrepreneur with a specialization in internet start-up companies, who has served as a contracting advisor for Mojang Studios since February 2011.

title: Pumpkin Pie
summary: Pumpkin pie is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Punch
summary: Punch is an enchantment for a bow that increases an arrow's knockback, much like the Knockback enchantment for melee weapons. This does not increase the damage of the bow.

title: Infinity
summary: Infinity is an enchantment to bows that prevents regular arrows from being consumed when shot. One arrow is needed to use a bow enchanted with Infinity.

title: Flame
summary: Flame is an enchantment that causes bows to shoot flaming arrows.

title: Power
summary: Power is a bow enchantment which increases arrow damage.

title: Wither Skeleton
summary: Wither skeletons are tall black variants of skeletons equipped with stone swords that inflict the poison-like Wither effect. They are found exclusively in nether fortresses and are the only source of wither skeleton skulls.

title: Nether Star
summary: The nether star is a rare item dropped by the wither that is used solely to craft beacons.

title: Pretty Scary Update
summary: The Pretty Scary Update is the name for Java Edition version 1.4.2, a major update officially released on Thursday, October 25, 2012.

title: Carrot on a Stick
summary: A carrot on a stick is an item that can be used to control saddled pigs.

title: Head
summary: A head is a block. There are six‌/seven‌ types of heads: player (Steve's head by default), zombie, skeleton, wither skeleton, creeper, piglin‌, and dragon.

title: Dragon Egg
summary: The dragon egg is a decorative block or a "trophy item", and is the rarest item obtainable in the game, as it generates once (or twice in Bedrock Edition).

title: Potato
summary:
A potato is a food item obtained from potato crops that can be used to plant them, consumed raw or cooked to make baked potatoes.
Potato crops are planted in farmland and used to grow potatoes and, rarely, poisonous potatoes.

title: Poisonous Potato
summary: A poisonous potato is a type of potato that can poison the player.

title: Golden Carrot
summary: A golden carrot is a valuable food item and brewing ingredient. It provides the second most saturation in the game, behind suspicious stew crafted with either a dandelion or blue orchid.

title: Baked Potato
summary: A baked potato is a food item that can be eaten by the player.

title: Wither
summary: The wither is a player-constructed undead hostile boss mob that floats and shoots explosive skulls at players and mobs. It is the only source of nether stars, which are used to craft beacons.

title: Lectern
summary: A lectern is a block used to hold written books for multiple players to read in multiplayer. It also serves as a librarian's job site block.

title: Tutorials/Animal farming
summary: Cooked meat is one of the best food options in the game, with Golden Carrots being its only competitor.

title: Wall
summary: A wall is a decorative block. Like fences, they can be used to create boundaries, because players and most mobs cannot climb or jump over them.

title: Flower Pot
summary: A flower pot is a decorative block that can contain flowers, bamboo, saplings, cacti, mushrooms, fungi, and other reasonably small plants.

title: Item Frame
summary:
An item frame is an entity‌ or block entity‌ that displays the item or block that is inside it.
A glow item frame keeps itself and the item inside it illuminated, even in the dark.

title: Tutorials/Update Minecraft
summary: This page will describe how you can update Minecraft, how to roll back and why you should wait to update.

title: Owen Jones
summary: Owen Jones, formerly known as Owen Hill, is the Director of Creative Communications at Mojang Studios. Before joining Mojang, Jones worked as the web editor for PC Gamer, where he gained a reputation for producing high-quality work at an equally high quantity, gaining the attention of Markus Persson, who became determined to hire him. In August 2012, it was announced that Jones would be bidding farewell to PC Gamer and would be moving to Stockholm, Sweden the following September to work with Mojang.

title: Villages.dat format

title: Zombie Villager
summary: A zombie villager is a variant of the zombie that can be cured into a normal villager using a golden apple while it is under the effect of Weakness.

title: Command Block
summary: A command block is a block that can execute commands.

title: Beacon
summary: A beacon is a block that projects a light beam skyward and can provide status effects such as Speed, Jump Boost, Haste, Regeneration, Resistance, or Strength to nearby players.

title: MINECON 2012
summary: MINECON 2012 was held in Disneyland Paris from November 24 to 25.

title: Invisible Bedrock
summary: Invisible bedrock is an invisible block used to create a world boundary around Old worlds.

title: Servers.dat format
summary: The servers.dat  is used to store information regarding the multiplayer servers that the player has added to their server list.

title: Tutorials/Combination locks
summary: Combination locks are a type of redstone circuit. They generally have a number of components which must be set in the right combination in order to activate something such as a door. Combination locks can be very useful in creating adventure maps. Note that if you are playing in survival multiplayer, other players will still be able to break into the mechanism and cause it to activate without knowing the password.

title: Skin pack
summary: Skin packs add additional skins that players may choose from along with the default skins included with the game's purchase. Skin packs are available in Bedrock Edition as purchasable content. They often feature characters from other video games, movies, and television shows, alongside original designs. Skin packs all have skins related to one another, e.g, a movie skin pack includes characters from only the designated movie. Skin packs are a way to quickly obtain several themed skins at once.

title: Add-on
summary: Add-ons are the first step toward bringing customization to all editions of Minecraft and are officially supported by Mojang/Minecraft.

title: Minecraft Indev
summary: Minecraft Indev refers to 10 versions of Indev released from February 6 to February 23, 2010.

title: Redstone circuits/Clock
summary: A clock circuit is a redstone circuit that produces a clock signal: a pattern of pulses that repeats itself.

title: Andrea Jörgensen

title: Paul Spooner

After being disappointed with his inability to build a tree fort in the small trees, he wrote a map modding tool which was then partially included in the base game. Unlike Daniel Rosenfeld, Spooner's in game character does not have a Mojang cape. Spooner has a deviantART account, and a YouTube channel.

title: Player.dat format

The format is also used within level.dat files to store the state of the singleplayer player, which overrides any <player>.dat files with the same name as the singleplayer player. These files are in NBT format.

title: Måns Olson
summary: Måns Olson is a game developer at Mojang Studios, currently working on the launcher for Minecraft and developing Minecraft Dungeons. Previously, he worked as the lead designer for Caller’s Bane.

title: NBT format
summary: The Named Binary Tag (NBT) is a tree data structure used by Minecraft in many save files to store arbitrary data. The format is comprised of a handful of tags. Tags have a numeric ID, a name, and a payload. A user-accessible version in the form of strings is the stringified Named Binary Tag (SNBT) format.

title: Speed
summary: Speed is a status effect that increases an entity's walking speed by 20% multiplied by the effect level.  It expands a player's field of view (FOV) accordingly.  Negative levels decrease speed.

title: Johan Bernhardsson
summary: Johan Bernhardsson is a former game developer at Mojang Studios, who worked extensively on Minecraft: Pocket Edition, and over a year by himself.

title: Tutorials/Playing and saving Minecraft on a thumb drive
summary:
Before beginning this tutorial, note that the following guides are only for the 2.x launcher. If you want to make Minecraft portable for an older launcher version, please view this page instead. 
This tutorial explains how to run Minecraft on a portable location (e.g. on a thumb drive). Portable installation is, an installation that is not "integrated" with the computer, which is useful for managing multiple installations and generally keeping things organised. This is useful if you want to retain your game data (launcher profiles, worlds, resource packs, etc.) when switching computers. 
If you are not planning to play Minecraft on a thumb drive but on your main hard drive instead, it's highly recommended for you to make the game portable with this guide because this will give you some big advantages over standard installation. If you store different Minecraft versions (1.8, 1.12, modded 1.12, modded 1.7.10, latest, etc.) in one folder/launcher instance, mods/worlds/settings from other versions may conflict with version you are currently playing. If you want to separate them on standard installation, you will have to also keep each folder of each version in .minecraft directory and rename them every time you want to change version you are currently playing. On portable installation only a folder and launcher script file is needed to be created and after following this guide you can just play selected version just by double-clicking on its script file. 
Note: After this guide the game will be only 99% portable: the game data will be stored and used by game and its launcher where you want but launcher will create .minecraft directory anyway and will be placing there (just only) its log files (like update logs, logs with game messages and crashes, etc.) If you really care about it, you can combine this guide with the guide for the old launcher: the game will create .minecraft directory if it doesn't exist anyway but will just leave it empty[unverified].

title: Tutorials/Installing a snapshot
summary: It is possible to play a future snapshot in Minecraft, as well as previous versions that have been released, and it is quite easy too. However, many people don't know how to use or install them. This tutorial shows you how to install and play any type of snapshot, development version, or previously released version that is available in the launcher, as well as snapshots that are no longer available in the launcher.

title: Tutorials/Mapping
summary: The map page explains how to craft maps and how they automatically draw themselves as you move through the world. That page also explains maps' limitations and pitfalls. For example, crafting a batch of maps all at once (using shift-click) is generally not helpful because they'll all be duplicates of one another.

title: Legacy Console Edition tutorial
summary: The Tutorial is a world that introduces the player to the basic mechanics of Minecraft. Available only in the Legacy Console Edition, it allows newcomers to familiarize themselves with the game, primarily with the controls and the crafting system. The world and presentation differ depending on the version of the game it was created in; however, the basic tutorial mechanics remain the same. All versions begin with the player in a small, enclosed area where building, crafting, mining, and survival mechanics are introduced. The tutorial world contains twelve hidden chests with a music disc that the player can search for.

title: Tutorials/Cocoa bean farming
summary: Cocoa beans can grow on the sides of any jungle log, regardless of light level, requiring 1 empty air block in the space it will occupy. The jungle log does not need to be attached to a living tree, only any harvested jungle log, therefore it is easy to create large farms for cocoa beans by chopping down jungle trees and arranging the wood to optimize growing space.

title: Large Biomes
summary: Large Biomes is a world type that generates Overworld worlds at a higher scale than in normal worlds. It does not affect Nether biomes at all.

title: Splitscreen
summary: Splitscreen is a console-exclusive feature that allows up to four players to play on one screen at the same time.

title: The Void
summary: The Void is an empty biome that generates only a 33×33 void start platform centered on a block of cobblestone at coordinates 8, 3, 8.

title: Written Book
summary: A written book is an item created after a book and quill is signed. It appears the same as a regular book, but without the quill, and has an enchanted-looking glint.

title: Book and Quill
summary: A book and quill is an item used to write written books.

title: Joe Liu
summary: Joe 'Noirceuil' Liu is a former customer support agent for Mojang who had previously worked with Marc Watson and Mike Till at a previous job.

title: Tutorials/Time-saving tips
summary: Minecraft contains a mixture of interesting things to do and routine operations such as resource collection which can get very dull and repetitive. But tastes differ, and different players view different parts of the game as the dull parts. This page collates a wide variety of time-saving tips for all aspects of the game.

title: Tutorials/Ubuntu startup script
summary: This is a simple startup-script for the upstart mechanism used by ubuntu-servers.

title: Village/Structure (old)/Blueprints
summary: Here are the blueprints for all of the old village buildings and tutorials showing how to build them.

title: Village/Structure/Blueprints
summary: Note that in zombie villages cobwebs sporadically replace any block besides chests, bells, crafting tables, carpets, water, and lava source blocks, doors and torches are destroyed, and all non-stained glass panes are turned into their respective brown stained variant.

title: Java Edition 1.2.1
summary: 1.2.1 is a major update to Minecraft (Java Edition) released on March 1, 2012, which adds a new height limit of 256 blocks (changed from 128) as a result of the new Anvil file format, zombie sieges, and generated features including jungle biomes, wooden bridges in mineshafts, and desert wells. It also added new blocks and items – bottles o' enchanting, redstone lamps, fire charges and chiseled stone bricks – and two new mobs, iron golems and ocelots.

title: Java Edition 1.2.2
summary:
1.2.2 is a minor update to 
Minecraft (Java Edition) released on March 1, 2012, to fix issues where some naturally generated features were not appearing in 1.2.1.

title: Java Edition 1.2.3
summary: 1.2.3 is a minor update to Minecraft (Java Edition) released on March 2, 2012, to fix some of the bugs and crashes in 1.2.1 and 1.2.2.

title: Java Edition 1.2.4
summary: 1.2.4 is a minor update to Minecraft (Java Edition) released on March 22, 2012, which adds new planks and sandstone blocks, improves chat editing, and fixes bugs.

title: Java Edition 1.2.5
summary: 1.2.5 is a minor update to Minecraft (Java Edition) on April 4, 2012, which improves functionality of the pick block key.

title: 0x10c
summary: 0x10c was a space sandbox game that was being developed by Markus "Notch" Persson and Mojang AB during 2012 and 2013 as a followup to Minecraft.

title: Java Edition hardware requirements
summary: Any computer can actually run Minecraft, even with low processor and graphics card.

title: Tutorials/Recover corrupted saved world data
summary: At times Minecraft will hiccup and drop a saved world from the list of those available.

title: World selection menu
summary: The world selection menu is one of the game's multiple menu screens, which allows access to the Create New World menu, and equally importantly listing preexisting worlds which can be entered.

title: Minicraft
summary: Minicraft is a 2D top-down action game made by Markus "Notch" Persson, for the 2011 48-hour game programming contest Ludum Dare 22.

title: Chain
summary: Chains are metallic decoration blocks.

title: Enchanting/Levels
summary: The minimum values are all calculated using a linear function y = kx+m	where y is the calculated minimum value, x is the current enchantment power level and k and m varies between different enchantments.

title: Tutorials/Organization
summary: Organization is a very important habit to have in Minecraft. Organization helps with finding things quickly and easily, especially later in the game when you have collected a lot of materials. It takes a long time to find what you need when it is cluttered up. This tutorial is intended for players who prefer to store items in specific categories.

title: Main menu
summary: The main menu is one of Minecraft's several menu screens.

title: Patrick Geuder
summary: Karl Patrick Geuder is a Mojang Studios employee who performs large-scale data analysis.

title: Mathias Andersson
summary: Mathias Andersson is a member of the brand enforcement team.

title: Anton Albiin
summary: Anton Albiin is a former member of the Mojang Studios customer support team. He left the company in March 2013.

title: Mike Till
summary: Mike Till is a former Mojang Studios customer support agent who worked with Marc Watson at their previous customer service job. When it became clear that more support staff would be needed, Marc requested that Mike be brought on. Mike is a gamer, and formerly of the US Army.

title: Karin Severinson
summary: Karin Severinson handles finances for Mojang.

title: Boat
summary: A boat is a drivable vehicle entity used primarily for fast transport of players and passenger mobs over bodies of water. Bamboo rafts‌ look different, but function nearly identically to other boats.

title: Healing
summary: Healing is the mechanic of regaining lost health.

title: Legacy Console Edition version history
summary: Legacy Console Edition is an umbrella term for the many editions of Minecraft for consoles that were in active development from 2012 to 2019.

title: Flying
summary: Flying is the most versatile form of transportation and is available in Creative and Spectator mode.

title: Tutorials/Hardcore mode
summary: Hardcore worlds are one of the most unforgiving types of Minecraft world.

title: Tutorials/Snow golems
summary: Snow golems are one of the two utility mobs in Minecraft. They can be used for a variety of purposes to benefit the player. This tutorial teaches many ways that the player can use snow golems to their advantage.

title: Tutorials/Defeating the ender dragon
summary:
The ender dragon is one of the two bosses in Minecraft, the other being the wither. She lives in the End, and is usually considered the final boss of the game, despite her being added first‌. 
The dragon is a highly anticipated boss to fight as her downfall grants the player access to the End's outer islands, via an end gateway portal. It also activates the exit portal and allow the player to return to the Overworld.

title: Kristoffer Jelbring
summary: Kristoffer Jelbring is a former game developer at Mojang Studios, working on Minecraft Dungeons. Prior to 2018, he was also a web developer. In December 2020, he left Mojang Studios.

title: Erik Broes
summary: Erik 'Grum' Broes is a game developer at Mojang Studios.

title: Tutorials/Enderman farming
summary: The purpose of an enderman trap is for the easy access and killing of endermen. It is possible for the user to create such a trap that can be used by simply standing still, and looking at the endermen. This angers any you look at, luring them into the trap. Most endermen traps are best suited to the End or warped forests, as endermen spawn at a considerably higher rate there. You can still create this trap in the Overworld, but endermen spawn far less often.

title: Tutorials/Programs and editors/MCSkin3D
summary: This page shows a third-party program.

title: Dispenser
summary: A dispenser is a low-capacity storage block that can fire projectiles, use certain items or tools or place certain blocks, fluids or entities when given a redstone signal. Items that do not have unique dispenser functions are instead ejected into the world.

title: Demo
summary: Official Minecraft demo releases available to try for free include:

title: Tutorials/Custom maps
summary: Custom maps are maps created by other players who can then upload the files online to share. You can then download these maps and play them. Note that this is not a list of maps; this just has suggestions of how to play and use maps. You can find a list of maps on other websites.

title: Warren Loo
summary: Warren 'EvilSeph' Loo is a game developer who formerly worked for Mojang Studios.

title: Tutorials/Beating a challenge map
summary: This tutorial contains many tips on how to complete a challenge map. Most of this tutorial is based on "complete the monument" styled maps, but will apply to any type of challenge map.

title: LEGO Minecraft
summary: LEGO Minecraft is a licensed LEGO theme of sets based on Minecraft.

title: Tutorials/Calculator
summary: This tutorial will show you how to make a calculator in Minecraft using redstone.

title: End spike
summary: End spikes, also known as obsidian spikes, obsidian pillars, obsidian towers, and end pillars are a feature in The End biome that are made of obsidian.

title: Tutorials/Programs and editors/Outdated
summary: A repository for outdated programs, defined as being more than one major version behind the current release. Anything that has not been updated for the full release of Minecraft is moved here. Note that some of these programs may still work with newer versions of Minecraft, but have not been clearly marked as such by their authors.

title: Nathan Adams
summary: Nathan 'Dinnerbone' Adams is a technical director at Mojang Studios who worked on Java and Bedrock editions, and its launcher.

title: Drops
summary: Drops are items that appear when mobs and some other entities die or when most kinds of blocks are broken.

title: Tutorials/Managing slimes in superflat mode
summary: On superflat maps, slimes spawn in enormous numbers, and dealing with them can become extremely tedious.

title: Plains
summary: Plains are temperate grasslands biomes. They are among the first biomes added to the game. There are two plains biome variants in the biome family. They are the second most common biome, with Forest being slightly more common.

title: Nathan Gilbert
summary: Nathan 'Tahg' Gilbert is a programmer who previously worked on the official Modding API for Mojang.

title: Tutorials/Superflat survival
summary: Living on a superflat world can be a hard task, even for experienced players. Although using a normal superflat world is fine, the best preset is Overworld, because it creates water and lava holes and tall grass. This guide shows how to survive and thrive in the classic superflat environment. However, it does not work for Bedrock Edition.

title: Tundra
summary: A tundra was a snow-covered biome and the precursor of the current snowy plains, but with fewer trees and no tall grass, tundras existed in the game prior to the Adventure Update (Beta 1.8 for Java Edition) or in versions before Alpha 0.9.0 for  Pocket Edition.

title: Forest
summary: Forests are temperate biomes. There are a total of two variants in the biome family. They are the most common biome in Minecraft, being only slightly more common than plains.

title: Beach
summary: Beaches are common coastal biomes that serve as transition biomes from the mainland to an ocean. There are three variants of beach biome.

title: Tutorials/Redstone computers
summary: This article aims to examine the design and implementation of redstone computers in Minecraft.

title: Iron Golem
summary: An iron golem is a large, powerful neutral utility mob that defends players and villagers. It is one of the few mobs that can be built then spawned in the game.

title: Tutorials/Videos
summary: Videos are an important part of Minecraft, ranging from gameplay, to minigames, to tutorials.

title: Tutorials/FreeBSD startup script
summary: This is an example of a possible Minecraft server rc.d startup script for FreeBSD.

title: Item (entity)
summary: Items are "dropped" blocks or items (non-block resources) that appear in the world, rather than being in the inventory of a player or block entity; they are a type of entity.

title: Tutorials/Surviving in a single area indefinitely
summary: If you are planning on staying in one area of the Minecraft world for a long time and don't want to deplete all your resources, read and complete this tutorial.

title: Tutorials/Programs and editors/Backup utilities
summary: Backup Utilities will make sure your saved games stay safe and can restore previously made backups upon errors.

title: Anvil file format
summary: Anvil is a file storage format. It brings a list of changes and improvements over from the previous file format, Region. It was implemented in snapshot 12w07a for release in Java Edition 1.2.1.

title: Tutorials/Randomizers
summary: Randomizers are redstone circuits that generate random signals. They can be used in a multitude of things, from running a light show, to making a casino. Note that randomizers, like the majority of redstone circuits, will only work in active chunks. If this is wanted for a adventure map or something where the player may get far away, it may be desirable to build the randomizer in spawn chunks‌ or a ticking area.‌

title: Tutorials/Playing on servers
summary: Minecraft is a single-player game (unless you're playing on multiplayer). You survive by yourself and your only friends are the animals that you will probably cook for food! Yet you might want to roam the world with friends. Just experience it with other players and more mobs

title: Zombie siege
summary: Zombie sieges are in-game events where many zombies spawn in and attack a village.

title: Java Edition unused features
summary: Since the beginning of Minecraft's development, there have been a number of features added to the game that have no actual use in Survival or in Creative.

title: Marc Watson
summary: Marc Watson is an associate producer at Mojang Studios, working with the New Games team. Prior to June 2020, Marc worked as a content manager. Before January 2016, he also worked as a customer support agent, rising to become a customer support administrator.

title: Saturation
summary: Saturation is an instant status effect that reduces the need for eating. It also prevents death by hunger if the player has no food.

title: Tutorials/Diamonds
summary: Diamonds are one of the most sought-after items in Minecraft, due to their use in crafting diamond and netherite tools, weapons, and armor. Diamonds are also one of the rarest ores in Minecraft along with emeralds, lapis lazuli, and ancient debris. This makes diamonds extremely difficult to find and severely limits a player's supply of diamonds. This tutorial is intended to help players who want to obtain, maintain, and expand their diamond supply.

title: Tutorials/Music disc farming
summary: Music discs can help break the silence of the world but they can often be difficult to obtain.

title: Desert Well
summary: Desert wells are features consisting of sandstone.

title: Fire Charge
summary: Fire charges are items that can be used as a single-use version of a flint and steel or shot as a small fireball from a dispenser.

title: Bottle o' Enchanting
summary: A bottle o' enchanting is a throwable item that releases experience orbs on impact.

title: Ocelot
summary: Ocelots are rare passive mobs found in jungles.

title: Jungle tree
summary: Jungle trees are generated structures native to the jungle biome. Jungle trees range from short bushes to tall trees that reach up to 31 blocks in height. Their wood is of a pale brownish color.

title: Jon Kågström
summary: Jon Kågström is the former AI programmer for Minecraft. He was hired for Mojang Studios on 28 December 2011, having previously worked on AI for Battlefield. He helped Mojang create new "smart" AI for the mobs in Minecraft. He played an active role alongside Jeb in developing Minecraft features, fixes, and improvements for Java Edition 1.2.1. After this, he left Minecraft development to work on Scrolls. Since the development of Scrolls was discontinued, it is unknown if he will ever work on Minecraft again.

title: Jungle
summary: A jungle is a temperate biome full of dense vegetation which generate in areas with high humidity values, often next to forests. There are three varieties of jungles.

title: Spruce
